V3YJBT5OMmW8nn5iQSOv_w.text: Great food, services, ambiance, etc. The manager Robert was very attentive and informative about the restaurant local area things to do. I would recommend this place to everyone. Priced right for what you get. I don't know what the bad reviews are about? Maybe local competition. This place exudes class ! ! !

urKP7hSq_TuYy5lDDfg70g.text: How big do you like your meat?  If you answer is HUGE AND RAW then Shula's is the place for  you. Fantastic selection of amazing beef. Everything from the moment you walk in the door feels so cozy and attended to.  I am no sports fan, however I am a football sized hunk of red meat fan. I highly recommend Shula's Steak House to anyone looking for an unforgettable experience dining in Chandler.  This is probably the finest steak house this side of Downtown PHX.

aiimv_hcjow3tBZNyZBV6g.text: Absolutely amazing food! Stellar service and awesome drinks. Our server Brian made the experience a great one, he took the time to explain and show us each cut and made suggestions on sides. By far some of the best service and Steaks I've had hands down... Oh and the bread... Nom Nom Nom

b_oFhVs6nsVoBjrBZQEa9w.text: Don't get me wrong, it's a fine steak and generally good food w/ solid service... BUT at the price point (100+ a head), you can do much better (think Mastro's - or if you need to be in a casino, Cholla steakhouse is a better option).  Reservations: + - OpenTable - super easy, table ready for us on arrival  Service: -  - Host was a goofy kid.  Very nice, but awkward and stumbling trying to sell the football story (hosts have to carry the football to the table and tell you about the 72 Dolphins) - Servers (lead + 1-2 supporting) were all nice and basically competent.  Seems like amateur hour for such a high-end steakhouse.  Watched as each passed my empty scotch several times w/ no one even offering another.  Too bad.  At 14/glass, that's 3 bucks a shot in their pocket they forgo...  still, nice, but again amateurish... no concept of cadence (drinks fast, bread slow, 1st course fast, steaks slow, long pause for desert menu, etc.) that you'd get at say Mastro's or even Morton's - Runner who brought 1st course put my caesar down and as expected as if I wanted cracked pepper... when I said yes, she disappeared around the corner to retrieve the pepper mill ??? - No serious complaints, but definitely not up to standards of competing entries at this price point.  Drinks: + - MacCallan 12 served w/ acqua panna cube - GOOD.  easy, but at least they do it right - Wife's foo-foo drink - YUMMY.  Not exactly sure what it was (some kinda fruity gin drink dressed w/ fresh fruit/berries), but it was really good.  Dinner: + / - - Bread was fresh and surprisingly good (to the point where it's worth mentioning) - Caesar salad - YUMMY, real, maybe just a bit overdressed - French Onion soop - MEH.  Turine and chess piping hot, but yet soup inside lukewarm (?) - soup obviously premade and cold - then put into the turine and covered w/ cheese w/ expectation that the baking would make it adequately hot... - NY Strip - GOOD cut, WELL-SEASONED, OVERDONE.  Wife ordered Medium, but was pretty close to Med-Well (fortunately, she actually likes med-well, but felt silly ordering such on a 45 dollar steak).  Despite the overcook, it was still tender and tasty - Bone-in Filet (special) - GREAT cut.  WELL cooked.  OVERSEASONED.  POOR Bearnaise.  My filet was a perfect med-rare and ridiculously tender, but unfortunately was a bit overseasoned (salty).  It was served w/ Bearnaise on the side, but it came room-temp and tasted like mayonnaise and parsley (bummer, I love the taste of tarragon and was happily surprised at first to see on the plate).  Still, the great quality of the steak itself made it quite good overall - Mashed Potato - YUMMY.  Simple mashed w/ garlic+nutmeg (one of my favorite flavor combos) - Sauteed Mushrooms - SO-SO.  Decent as a steak topper, but not much flavor (odd given the types of mushrooms used) - Creamed Spinach - SOLID.  Heavy as one would expect with nice flavor.  Desert: N/A - Didn't bother as we were ready to move on at this point and the menu really didn't have anything that looked especially great  Dining Room: - - Loud, but not in a good high-end steakhouse way (like Gibson's in Chicago)...  - Cheesy, amateurish attempt at high-end environment - silly signed football placed on table listing the cuts (same as on menu), but autograph is on the underside of the ball, so you're not even sure who signed it. - Not dark, not bright.  Bottom Line:  Very high quality ingredients w/ competent preparation.  Generally solid, but not close to high-end service.   Should I find myself staying at Wild Horse Pass again (quite a nice hotel/casino for PHX), I'll be picking Ling & Louie's for dinner instead...  Just not worth the money overall.

7L-3Eq5J5zhe2bn8WsPyAA.text: Wonderful dinner - had the Cowboy ribeye.... Sauces not as good...Shula Sauce my preference.  Truffle fries very taste and a must have Coco-Rita was delicious!

irkP1A19SFvxqOZ8oo-SdA.text: My second visit to Shula's and this experience was nothing like the first.   Celebrating 2 years of sobriety and the pressure to order alcoholic beverages was disturbing.  Felt like we were treated differently than all the tables around us that we consuming alcohol.  Beverages sat empty and our main waiter only visited our table again after I gestured to get him to the table.  The secondary wait staff constantly reached over in front of us to pick up plates and serve coffee.  Two of three Filets were over cooked.  Sides of Lobster Mac n Cheese and asparagus were great.  Ordered molten lava cake for desert.  Then we waited 20 minutes after our desert for our bill.  I actually called the main number to the restaurant to get the manager to our table because no waiters were in sight for such a long time.   We spent almost 3 hours at the table while other larger groups around us arrived and departed. When we complained to the manager the only thing we heard was how the wait staff said there was no delay.  Our bill was comped for 2 coffees and the desert.  I have been to some much nicer steak restaurants in the area and the service and food have not failed after numerous visits.

BlEm6U0X9zIQpop-VzNubA.text: Just had dinner at shulas haven't been been here since visiting Miami location back when shulas first opened. I'm at the wild horse pass in chandler, az. Best dining experience I've had in along time. Alejandro and Brian were our servers and made our dining experience that much more enjoyable. I thank every one at shulas for an unforgettable experience . Can't wait to come back!!!!!!!

OGkeoZ8nvMXfayWDPLIq-Q.text: The food is amazing and the staff is great. Been here plenty of times and it has always been an awesome experience. Their crab Mac and cheese is my new favorite just like our server said it would! Lol

-PFT-cDG6qF9EI14lb39zw.text: Our entrees, drinks and desserts were well prepared and very tasty! Service by Linda and Manny made our experience top notch! We highly recommend this place for a special date or engagement and will be back for another extraordinary meal!!

NP1p8eGw9U_HJHU1HhP8RA.text: Shula's is located on the second floor of the Wild Horse Pass Hotel and Casino. There is a bit of walking to get to the restaurant and the ventilation in the casino needs some work. However, once inside the restaurant, any smell from the casino seems to disappear.  I made a reservation using OpenTable a week before as I assumed the restaurant might have a lot of guests since my work and another large group were attending conferences in the area and staying in the hotel. No matter the combination of time and party size, there was only one spot available. When I entered the restaurant, there were many open tables available.   The service here is a hit and miss. The receptionist seemed like a snob, not saying a word when I told them my name and reservation time. They just grabbed menus and gave me a look to follow. Maybe this person was too good for my group and I? We were also introduced to two rather enthusiastic waitresses which I didn't mind at all, but were absent quite a bit during our meal.  I didn't get a tour of the restaurant like some of the fellow reviewers had, but I was perfectly without it. I felt that the football and the menu of the steaks on it is a nice touch (luckily it was not placed on top of our plate) and the cart showing how each cut of steak looks is neat. I opted for the cowboy steak (medium rare) while my coworkers order the filet mignon (medium).   My cowboy steak was cooked perfectly while also having a little crust. I honestly felt that it was delicious. My coworkers filet mignon appeared to be good and they enjoyed it. We also ordered the lobster mashed potatoes and crab mac and cheese. The lobster mashed potatoes were decent while the crab mac and cheese were not special. Both seemed to have a subpar amount of seafood.  Prices are comparable to any steakhouse. I might come back when I attend another conference in the area and too lazy to drive to the restaurants off Ray Road.

XQGmScpGji2Eolhz1-CYWw.text: I love this place.  Great food and great service!

DAKh-Iz0sOxjmqvAzbBABA.text: Shula's tries to combine upscale steakhouse with football to disastrous (though frequently hilarious) results.  They take you on a "tour" before seating you, showing you a replica Lombardi trophy and telling you all about the '72 Dolphins undefeated season. I found it especially hysterical the hostess took extra care to point out this trophy is a replica. You mean the real Lombardi trophy isn't kept at a steakhouse inside a shitty Indian casino in Chandler, AZ???? Shocking. Equally entertaining was how the hostess kept droning on about the '72 Dolphins long after we made it clear we didn't care. Um lady? It's just me and 2 female coworkers. We're all hungry and none of us give a shit about the '72 Dolphins. Apparently we were also supposed to be impressed by the black-and-white pictures of the '72 Dolphins on the walls. Oooh, black-and-white pictures, how artsy. Someone took a couple photography classes at community college.  After concluding that fascinating "tour" we were finally taken to our table. We were all exchanging "that was weird" looks when the waitress handed us our drink menus and explained the steak menu was painted on the football she was carrying. I know what you're thinking, and the answer is yes, it was a regulation sized football and yes, it was hand painted. She made sure to mention this last fact twice. I mean, what kind of upscale steakhouse would it be if its steak menu was painted on a football by a... MACHINE??? Pish posh.  Anyway, that's when things went from amusing to "I will never set foot in this restaurant again." The hostess puts the football on a tee and sets it down RIGHT ON MY COWORKER'S PLATE. Gross. I wish I had taken a picture cuz the look on her face was PRICELESS. The waitress seemed shocked and somewhat offended she asked for another plate. The nerve!!!  And this, my friends, was the straw that broke the proverbial '72 Dolphins back. I can handle being bored to death by an over-enthusiastic hostess. I can handle my menus hand painted on footballs. But if you have the nerve to charge $50-60 for a steak as this supposedly "upscale" steakhouse does, I will not tolerate a dirty football on my plate nor being treated like asking for a clean plate is an outrageous request.  We left without even drinking our waters

pLldPik_2-QhVYzuotv5sw.text: Had dinner before a Kansas concert here on August 5th. Service was very good. As others have said, the steaks were very good but did not break through to great. I'm not impressed with the table side showing of the various cuts. Who goes to a steakhouse and doesn't know what a strip, ribeye or filet looks like? Between eight of us we covered the three cuts mentioned above. Not a bad piece meet among them. Sides were generous, definitely enough for 2. We had the twice baked and it was as good as any I've had. If you like cheese (I do) you like it. One disappointment was the wine list didn't have more than about 10 each of reds and whites. Not cheap, but priced at or slightly lower than Ruth's Chris or, our favorite, Arrowhead Grill in Glendale. Pricing seems fair for food almost, but not quite up to these other two places.

ZfC2qwXpktqKq8IMQgXFGg.text: Ok so I have no frigg'n clue who Don Shula is or was! Not even sure if he is dead or alive. Ain't gonna google it either. ( ok maybe now I will) Fillet was great. Mashed potato's Yum! Asparagus! I cus, you cus, we all cus for asparagus. Great! Great service. Look, I don't go out of my way for a steakhouse. I can do a fillet at home for the fraction of the cost. To go to a steak restaurant is almost a waste. I want to eat out somewhere that I can't create at home. That being said. On the east side of town, if you at the casino, if you want MEAT ( insert manly grunt) this place is fabulous. I was well fed and not stuffed and weighed down. Clean and comfortable.

e2S9S8LFJNhJYE5z9hEa7A.text: Great food and great service!!!  We went with a large group on Valentine's Day and had a nice meal.  To start my girlfriend had the wedge salad and I had the lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was very good. We both had filets. Hers was the bone in filet with mashed potatoes and mine was the filet Oscar. The steaks were cooked perfectly and were flavorful and juicy. We split the crab Mac and cheese for our side which could have feed 3 people. There were big pieces of crab in it. Yum!! For dessert we shared the dulce de leche cheesecake and it was outstanding. Overall we had a great time and can't wait to return. Expect to spend some coin cause its a little pricey but worth every penny.

XErKMmfPYr2qU34nQqZTMQ.text: The hubby and I went back on Halloween since we had a bad experience for my bday and they were trying to redeem themselves. The host and hostess that were on were super friendly and smiled liked hosts should.  The restaurant was clean, as it should be.  Jeannie, Jeff, and Tyler (the one that has been there longer) were the people taking care of us.  Jeannie was really nice, seemed timid and unsure, I even had to tell her how to do one of the comps at the end.  We started with french onion soup (always a great choice), and blackened scallops with mango salsa ( tasted great, but was $14 for 2, salsa was okay, not a fan of mangoes).  Jeff took our order because they had gotten other tables, (just because there are 3 people helping each team does not mean they can handle 6 tables and still be effective). He got the chicken, meh; he liked it, but then again he will eat just about everything.  I got the quarterly special because it comes with the pecan tart.  I asked for my steak to be mid rare and it came out medium, I let them know and said I didn't want it remade because I didn't want to wait that long for my meal to come back, the steak had really dry overcooked onions and mushrooms topping it, (told Bob but he made it seem like I was crazy since they are cooked to order, STILL HAPPENS!)  I did get the lobster add on, Jeff tried to push me into the bigger one which was $15 more but I had already stated which one I wanted, don't be pushy. It was good.  For the sides we got steamed asparagus, scallop potatoes, and truffle fries, (the truffle fries tasted like regular fries with parsley, tasted no truffle oil, and saw a couple specks of parm but couldn't taste it).  For dessert we had the chocolate bourbon pecan tart with vanilla bean ice cream.  We had the same thing on my bday and it was AMAZING!, however, this time it wasn't the same, I was informed that it came from the same company but that doesn't mean squat to me, the only way you are going to know that it didn't change at all is if it was made in house...speaking of, why is a restaurant of this "quality" not making their own desserts?  If I had know that the tart was going to taste like that then I would have gotten something else all together.  Tyler was great! always filled our glasses, actually both of them ended up helping us and they did better than the servers.  Jeff asked if we wanted the rest of our stuff boxed up, and then decided that he needed to help other tables instead and pushed it off on the new Tyler, and while he ran to get the to go ramekins I stole the boxes and did it myself since I was ready to go and could do it quickly.  Took 20 minutes to get our bill and have Jeannie take the comps off and give it back, I didn't have to wait for change (luckily) because I made sure to have enough cash.  Bob was out doing his table touches and every time he came to our table he gave an awkward feeling, it was not natural at all, seemed very uncomfortable which I thought was weird since talking to him on the phone was great and he was funny, but not in person.    I think it is going to be a while before we go back, every time it seems to be something and for a restaurant that charges that much, it should never be anything that is less than outstanding

oTE4A7Qslo8Aze5cUZ1ZRQ.text: My husband and I celebrated our Anniversary with a fabulous meal. Our servers, Jeff and Dan were incredibly friendly and the level of attention... just right. The food was cooked to perfection. Sure it's pricey, but it was meant to be an experience, not just dinner. And they delivered.

UEU6v0iLgNxP88bNsm0Ocw.text: Was nowhere near perfect... They didn't allow me to wear a baseball cap although it's a sports themed steak house the steaks are close to perfect the twice baked potato was ok the steak fries are tasty the salad was ok but the ranch wasn't very good..

4sB9aQSaUpPDjTi9aXnN5g.text: We have read several reviews but no one has mentioned two of our favorites! That would be the bbq shrimp and the twin tails are to die for. Service has always been great and by the way check out the mixed grill. A wonderful way to check the steak and bbq shrimp, Fantastic and worth every dollar!

jXb2AfkXwM-cUfKrjownDg.text: Mediocre and overpriced. All steaks at our table were overdone. Sides were overseasoned and unspectacular. Dessert was generic. Would have perhaps been acceptable at a 25% lower price point, but their prices place them toward the top tier of steakhouses, which they are nowhere near. On the positive side, the restaurant itself is beautiful and well architected, and the service was very good. It's a shame that the waiters don't have a better product to peddle.

RNmqZYw-dwQ7WMAY5g1icg.text: The food was not bad, this is more of a value rating. This is supposed to be a top end steak house and they charge too end prices. I thought the service was average-attentive but they forgot a few things which weren't big deal but you expect them to forget.   Steaks were cooked as asked, which is always nice and the bar served honest drinks

kVEbbljCjzOlvYtJxohgng.text: This is Definitely one of the nicer places I've gotten down on some rib eye... I had the Scallops with the agave syrup..  Cowboy cut Ribeye and Crab Stuffed Mac & cheese....   The scallops were perfection and the Crab stuffed Mac &  Cheese was to Die for...  Yes it was that good..  The steak though was Good and above par but not as tender and flavorful as you would think for a $50 steak... Still a really good steak none the less   They had a quality selection of Bourbon (I had Bookers Neat) and that steps them up above most...   Now where they lost a star aside from the less then perfect steak was service...  Now it wasn't bad but believe me when I tell you there is a such think as over served...   I went stag yet felt as though I had a dinner guest...  I went in @ opening time and there was no one else in the restaurant....

LjwsNNy12-nSIHrVg7yObw.text: We went to shulas last night for our anniversary.  Our reservation was for 615pm, we arrived at about 610pm, we were greeted very politely and the host congratulated us on our anniversary and escorted us to our seat.  The dining room was very clean and inviting.  Our waiter introduced himself immediately and took our drink orders.  Drinks came out quickly along with some amazing hot fresh bread.  The waiter discussed specials and left us the look at the menu.  He returned shortly and asked if we had any questions, we ordered at that time.  We started with the seafood trio which was absolutely incredible, up on finishing the trio, our salads came, wife had the wedge salad and I chose the caesar.  Salads were delicious!  Next came the main course, wife had a bone in filet, yes, a bone in filet!  I had the medley of filet medallions, crab cake, and scallops with a corn salsa!  Food was incredible and service was over the top.  Our bill was around $180 before tip.  Worth every penny and this experience set the bar and was the best overall dining experience I've ever had!!  Highly reccomend!  We will be back!!!  Great job Shulas and thank you for a memorable evening!

uth6X5hfaVWGShRrThslug.text: I visit AZ every April to see clients.  For the past dozen years we have been eating at Shula's or one other steakhouse on our visit.  We will no longer be dining at Shula's.  This past Friday we had a group of 7 at the WHP location.  We had two servers, which makes you think that you will get great service, however, that was not the case.  Not only was the service horrific, but we were charged a mandatory 20% gratuity - for a party of 7 receiving horrible service.  No thanks

gi04c-ssdLl6U3oYLNkCdw.text: The service and staff were very nice. The problem that I had was with the food. In a nutshell, the 22 oz bone-in ribeye that I ordered medium came out between medium well to well done. It was also extremely salty and overpriced. Usually a steak with this thickness is easier to undercook than to overcook. I'm uncertain if they were in a rush to close for the evening hence why my selection arrived this way.  It's an establishment that tries to look hoity toity with the push cart menu but the quality doesn't seem to compare. Just my personal opinion, I would spend my money elsewhere even with the casino comps.

SPC0tUHDUoBiwMKE0zZmtw.text: Unbelievable disappointment. Sat at the bar for dinner. The younger one was glued to two gentlemen at the end discussing recent gambling activities. They were obvious regulars which seemed to make anyone else at the bar inconsequential and yes I mean it to be that strong. The other bartender, a little older, was much more aware of the dynamics of customer service but due to the other one not contributing at all, he had to spread himself thin. We didn't have a good feeling about service so we just ordered one rib eye steak and creamed spinach and kept it simple. Then it really went downhill, both the steak and the GREY creamed spinach tasted like the cook dumped a salt shaker on them. It was beyond belief salty. The salt on the steak was obviously put on late as it was just sitting on it, not dissolved, just poured on it. The spinach was grey, like pencil lead grey and, yes, salty! It was so much it was bizarre. This was our first time there, we didn't know the cook, owe him money or have somehow pissed him off! So, we wait, to talk to one of the bartenders, wait, wait, wait...... Then when the older one, still making up service for the younger one not moving from his post with the 2 guys at the end, finally came by, we told him the issues, paid and left. The food was so bad, and we had to wait for so long, by that time it felt like we were stuck in a bad meal time warp with no escape. We just wanted out.  One more fact which made this so bizarre - there were only 4 tables of customers in the restaurant area. This was not a busy time so that can't be a contributing reason.

GGkSh1EZZlXYuHQCwALm-Q.text: If your looking for elegance and pristine dining Shula's is the place to go. The lobster is amazing in fact everything is including Brian the water. It's definitely upscale and really good from the time you walk in until you leave your treated like royalty. It's truly delicious I've eaten there many times , just had a party of ten in honor of my sons birthday and everyone totally enjoyed everything

2f2VpJAYONn1vMP3tPh1tg.text: Excellent cooperation on changing our large group reservationat least 4 times! Don't judge - have you ever tried to coordinate 4 kids with active social and work lives?!  Outstanding Service. Outstanding! Great cocktail menu and you can lose yourself in the extra fresh wedge salad and crusty bread.....but DON'T.  Save yourself for the scallops (divine), lamb (lovely) and steaks (decadent).

XVTNoCVWViFYPbPmVcEZWg.text: These poor souls messed up my Christmas dinner by overbooking 80 seats. Staff was taxed and ended up with poor service and overcooked food. Crab legs were watered down and smelled horrible. Ordered the cowboy steak ended up with an overcooked porterhouse. The augrautin potatoes just plain sucked.  Drinks took over 20 minutes to get. When the check is over 300 bucks it's important they get it right. Very disappointed. Wake up Shulas!

murBPYlIfniSOCxTKAd9-A.text: Delish as always!! Little known secret for my fellow desert dwellers, this place has impeccable seafood, I highly recommend the surf and turf or the seafood trio appetizer.  Service here is amazing expect to be referred to by your name and every need meet. The steak is like butter, I heard a table refer to the lobster melting in his mouth like cotton candy.  The manager visited our table and the the martini was perfect!

9gXQdDYT3d_zIgX98u3SQw.text: Celebrated my birthday here this past weekend and it was phenomenal! Dan and Bryan were our servers and did a tremendous job. They explained the menu, the cut of steaks, gave recommendations and were very friendly and personable. Everything was spaced out perfectly and we didn't feel rushed at all.  The food was amazing!! We had scallops appetizer, ribeye, filet, lobster tail, Brussels sprouts and chocolate cake for dessert. Everything was delicious! A perfect place for celebrations or just a night out. We'll be back soon! Thanks Shulas!

cIA2fEjefZgyoCTZlykuBg.text: Don't expect speedy service.  It's not happening here!  We waited 20 minutes for our drinks.  The waiter never brought bread and when we were ready to leave we waited another 30 minutes for a carry out box and the check.  We would've had better luck throwing the $300 into a slot machine.  If you like terrible service then this is the perfect place.

zKB4VG7UWicrtQgWkKzeZg.text: Went here for my B-Day. Totally unimpressed with the steaks. The BS they spout about the 'Shula Cuts' being higher quality than Prime is laughable after eating there. I buy and make Prime steaks at my house that are 100x better and cost $8/lb from Costco.  Filet was decent, but nothing special Cowboy Ribeye was bad. Way too lean and tough. No flavor.  The sides, Creamed Spinach and Roasted Corn were both fantastic, though overpriced for the quantity. Quality & Flavors were excellent.  Service was excellent.  I go to a lot of top-end places: Flemings, Mortons, Ditka's, etc... Shulas was the least impressive. I found The Keg to be better by a mile - even without considering the price.

w1xJGVhQCLVfvJNZ5Loi5A.text: We went here for dinner for my boyfriend's birthday and it was absolutely perfect. We started with dirty martinis with blue cheese olives and they were the best we had ever had then we shared a bottle of The Prisoner and it was delicious as always. For food, we started with the oysters on the half shell which were super fresh and really delicious especially with the atomic horseradish. I had the 8oz filet and the surf and turf. My boyfriend had the Kansas City Strip; Both were cooked to perfection. We also split the Crab Mac and Cheese, Grilled Asparagus, and Truffle Fries. The Crab Mac and Cheese was my favorite thing I ate all night. It was garlicky, creamy, cheesy, and full of lump crab meat. The Truffle fries were perfectly crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. We ended with the 7 layer chocolate cake which was entirely too decadent to finish. In addition to the amazing meal, the service was spot on. We had a fantastic night at Shula's and highly recommend it to anyone.

uGasLQe39RDdCjJ-SJm8qg.text: If I could afford to eat at this place every day, I would!!! You're paying top dollar for this steak. It's super worth it! And it's inside the casino! I can go forever about how much I love this place. So let's me tell you what I get.  I place the order of my crab mac and cheese, my girlfriend and I usually split that. With the order of the bacon wrapped BBQ shrimp. So delicious. The order only comes with 4, but they are jumbo size. Then we place an order of the 12 oz filet mignon for her and the 24 oz porterhouse for me. My friend always gets the ribeye but I prefer the porterhouse. They are both really delicious. Shulas also has a big selection of wine and spirits. There's something for everyone.  Between us two we always end up paying about $180 or a little more. Like I said, it's pricey but once you try it you'll never regret it. It's a once in a while thing for me but I'm always looking forward to the next time! Super friendly staff and excellent service. See you guys soon!

eh5my4Ew1HMi90Epy__zHg.text: I would say for the price I paid for a meal, needs to bump up a notch.  Had the wedge, ribeye and twice baked potatoe.  All was good, but not spectacular as i would expect of a high end steak house.

hywtSOzYkhcWbMuVZiZ2ZA.text: One of the worst steak house I have ever been to.  They do not know how to cook their steak.  Order them medium rare and they will give you well done and you send it back and they will give you raw meat.  And they service is the worst thing I have ever seen.  When I ask told them that my steak was over cooked they argued with me that it was cooked right.  They were not apologetic.  Instead they were acting like they were doing me a favor by not charging me for my steak that I didn't eat.  I highly recommend that you do not try this place.  Meat quality is not up to par and service and cooking skill is good as cheap diner.

Hk2841dm81WlXEZyO13ybA.text: If you like steak this is the place to go!  I cringed when my partner asked for barbecue sauce to dip his filet in because the cuts are superior to any steakhouse I've ever been and cooked to perfection.  We also tried the scallops and they were cooked as well as the steak. The asparagus was also good.  Their shrimp cocktail was also super good.  Tip: save room for dessert! They have an awesome selection.

vKBFUe0Z3qKHcoDnmAPoHQ.text: Steak was mentioned as better than prime cut.  But, my steak and my friend's came out hard.  The cut tasted like Select cut.  Appetizers, sides, and dessert were ok.  I've experienced better steak.

hCj17rWtYkCKqtyAtMDgtQ.text: Great all around! Had the trip steak scallops and BBQ shrimp and the steak was cooked correctly.  The shrimp were slightly cool, not hot but had a good taste. I held back since it was my nephew's birthday (21st)! Service was okay could have been a little better, but was negligible as to how much better it could have been.  I recommend this place and I'm not going to wait as long before I go back. It's pricey and was good no disappointments!

oRjpSFcvjzDGivwkt-fMrA.text: We were not impressed. At first, we were very excited to taste their food and we ordered a wide range of their plates.  Unfortunately, flavors were lacking. Steaks were tender but kitchen did not deliver any talent in its execution. Crab Mac & cheese was bland, filet mignons were equally bland.  Asparagus dish was the highlight of our dinner, it was excellent.  We do not recommend Shula's.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Good, not great
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Good, not great

kmjUQTVu2vIc_9GPI20g3g.text: Fantastic!  Brian (Our Waiter) was informed, there whenever You looked around and Human.  I say that because He wasn't a robot like waiter.  Very nice Man.  The food was over the top good and cooked perfectly.  We have been there before and We will go again!!!

Yk7h2JdHd30bcC152vEKwA.text: Oh my God this place is incredible, Donald is an amazing bartender. Mathew is an incredible manager.  This place has incredible food, atmosphere, love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Oh my God this place is incredible,

l-qQg0mC4eJNCQ714Kdd6g.text: Disappointing would be the best word to describe my experience. It was a typical busy end of the month Saturday night for us and we made reservations for 8:30 pm(since we worked late that day).The restaurant is located UPSTAIRS in the Wild Horse Hotel/Casino and it is much easier to park with HOTEL SIDE Valet then to try and navigate the garage or parking lot.. From there you will avoid the excessively smoky casino main floor as well. We arrived a couple of minutes early and checked in at the Shula's desk. There is absolutely no waiting area for guests,with the exception of two livingroom chairs....,so... it is whoever can plop their fat ass in there the fastest. Unfortunately I never was that great at musical chairs..haha..  You are forced to stand and wait or go back outside to the smoke. We were seated 12 minutes late..no big deal,..then left alone for 6 minutes at a very cold 2 seater table ( under the vent) with no water or bread. Once we were initially served ( they were cordial) we were given menus and some iced water and wine options. 7 minutes later the comp bread and butter came out and it was crunchy and delicious. We ordered the NY Strip 16 oz,,medium,lobster bisque soup, blackened scallop appetizer and wedge salad with vinegarette and asparagus. It was a birthday treat ,so they later comped us a nice chocolate cake slice with strawberry decor...which was very tasty initially but super sweet...could not finish it. The salad was crisp and delicious and the dressing was just right with the blue cheeze bacon toppings. The Lobster bisque tasted like a lukewarm bowl of canned soup, bland,milky and for $12 bucks a major flop...we sent it back and asked to delete from the order. The 16 oz boneless strip steak came next and it was thick and cooked properly but very salty and overly quick- seasoned.  I have had much better cuts at the K*g for a better value....it did not settle very well with my stomach either.  But that being said,it was grilled correctly, just not marinated the right way....too chewy. The asparagus was steamed to perfection and it was by far the best prepared part of the meal. Kudoos for perfect asparagus...so you got that going for you...which is nice. if you LOVE noisy restaurants, this is the place for you...the decible level inside the place was louder than the bar area with the reggae jazz band.....a little bit annoying for fine dining. The scallops were limp and burnt ( they claim they were not and when I sent them back the waitress brought me back one with the black scraped off of the scallop. I thought that was piss poor service from a steak house. They did not remove them from the ticket,so 14 dollars was wasted. I didn't gripe since they comped the chocolate cake.....just know I won't be back here. Too slow, too noisy and food............well you can get a better meal at Bla** Ang** or The Ke* for way less strain on your wallet. Maybe they have so much business from the casino it doesn't matter....but if I was a Shula, i would have the manager running two-a days to get in shape and studying the playbook. CT*

RbV35Qc4S1V_fAvMB5LFpw.text: This is a great steakhouse, especially if you're looking for a USDA prime steakhouse that's not in the downtown or Scottsdale area. It's inside the Wild Horse Pass Hotel.  The decor rings classic steakhouse. It has dark woods, an elegant ambiance, and waiters in traditional tuxedos. There is a lot of football memorabilia to honor Don Shula (hence the name). The wait staff is very good for an upscale restaurant. They knew the menu well and were very friendly.  The bread is great, warm yet crusty, and served with butter. I had the seared ahi appetizer, which was excellent. It was perfectly rare with sesame seasoning.  I had the 12 ounce filet, cooked medium rare with a nice char on the outside. It had a great degree of marbling, as you would expect from prime beef. Overall, a very solid filet.  For sides, I had creamed spinach and potatoes. Both were great and clearly every element was homemade.  Dessert was a dark chocolate layer cake. It was moist and decadent, definitely a must for chocolate lovers like myself.

3FHi40pnrd0HGeb3_y6oBw.text: My wife and I just went on Saturday November 11th to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary. Although the meal was tasty and the service by the wait staff was wonderful, we wont be back. Here's why.  Sitting next to us was a party of 12 very loud very obnoxious and clearly inebriated men who never shut up, even when food arrived. The wait staff knew it and made several comments about it, and I informed the manager, who said she would talk to them about it. If she did, which I doubt, there was no action taken. An offer to reseat us to a different table after we are 3/4 of the way through our meal is useless. Besides there was no location in the restaurant that you couldnt hear their yelling.   They should have been given an option to be quiet or leave. But your staff is clearly more interested in making money. You wont be getting any more of ours. And we live here, so we would have been more frequent customers, as opposed to these people, who were clearly visitors.   Very very disappointed in your organization Don Shula. I was a fan of those 1972 Dolphins. I dont believe your commitment to be the best  Follow up. I submitted an email through their online web contact form. I got back an email that started with   Hello [your-name],  Thank you for contacting Us!  One of our Team Shula members will respond shortly.  No contact in over a week Nice way to treat your customers

_IUcC4M8IEj71qiPtVq3zw.text: Dined here tonite for my husbands 60th bday. We didn't have bad service, we had no service. What a big disappointment for the price and occasion. They were not busy but yet never saw one of are two servers, couldn't order a drink or even get a desert. Food was fine but no one bothered asking...I wouldn't recommend this place.

qmN1wudNjbKdsU3kLUApTg.text: My husband and I made a reservation for our anniversary dinner, and had a lovely celebration. He ordered the 14 ounce boneless ribeye and I got the scallops. We had a calamari appetizer and potatoes au gratin to share. The restaurant gave us a complimentary seven layer cake for our special occasion. Very good service and very good food.

UhHNJdU0vfI3n-w7qdkuDA.text: 1st item to mention which could have been a deal breaker is Shulas' is located so that you don''t have to walk through the smokey casino to enter. We were seated in a booth with no one near us. It was quiet, the service was top notch, little spendy but certainly worth it. Filet Mignon trio was outstanding. Great steaks so give it a try

QFD27sI9pfb2eD94Jh_0JQ.text: Absolutely wonderful! My husband and I went for his birthday dinner and felt like we were in Las Vegas. The restaurant is beautiful and the staff was incredible. We started with soup and salad. The burrata salad was fantastic. I even asked for extra pickled onions because they were so good. My husband had the French onion soup that was very good. We then shared a fried lobster tail that was a special for the night recommended by our waiter. He was right and it was amazing and very memorable. Next we went for the porterhouse that we shared. On top of all the wine, I was stuffed and didn't have much room left for the steak. I still managed to have some and it was great. They also gave us a birthday desert for my hubs that was delicious and very much appreciated. We will definitely be back for special occasions and recommend the restaurant very highly.

GKNZtZ7R9iW2EpplTXALUw.text: Shula's Steak House!   Let's do lunch......Nope, not a good idea.  Having dined numerous times at Shula's in the evening, was excited to learn that they were now open for lunch.  BIG MISTAKE.  We arrive about 1 pm and are promptly seated.  Our "waitress" brought water and took our drink order, which was promptly delivered.  Looking over the menu, the Market seafood caught my wife's eye and she inquired about what was available.  Today they had Salmon and Chilean Sea Bass.  As Sea Bass is her favorite, that's what she ordered, pan seared with beurre blanc sauce.  I ordered the steak sandwich with garlic wedge fries. We also ordered a Caesar Salad to share which our "waitress" delivered promptly.  Then we became invisible.  The adjacent table received their salads from their server, along with Shula's fresh out of the oven bread, which never made an appearance, probably because we were invisible.  Drink glasses were refilled at her other two tables, while ours sat empty.  Although the other guests were seated within 10 feet of ourselves, not one time in the 4 trips she made did our "waitress" ever look in our direction.  Probably because we were still in visible.  Only after she came to remove the salad plates was I able to beg for a refill of our beverages.   After another 20 minutes she arrives with our lunch.  One problem, sorta like our invisibility, the Chilean Sea Bass could not be found.  Some how it had magically turned into Salmon.  Not my wife's favorite nor what she ordered.  "Waitress" wanted to know if wife wanted to keep the asparagus and potatoes  while she returned the Salmon to the kitchen.  No thank you.  As our "waitress" hurried off to the kitchen for some more magic, wife decided she didn't want to wait another 1/2 hour to eat, while watching me eat my sandwich.  We ended up sharing my sandwich.   "Waitress" offered us a piece of chocolate cake as compensation, but declined due to the fact my wife is diabetic.   Manager comped the salad. Steak sandwich and two drinks cost me $25. plus a $5 tip.  Not a happy experience all around.  I guess we'll stay invisible at Shula's for a while, at least during the lunch hour.

Np8V8i-tYTWZlcWH2MJKJw.text: Such a nice place. The servers are quite knowledgable about steaks and the different cuts of meat.  I had the sea scallops and crab Mac and cheese. Both were delish.  The lobster bisque looked great along with the steaks. The twice baked potato was huge and very good.  Extensive wine and cocktail list. Service was A+.  We didn't need a reservation for 730 on a Wednesday night but seems like you might on s weekend.  Lots of Shula artifacts around the place. But if you aren't into football, it's no big deal.  The casino underneath does allow smoking so you can smell the smoke as you enter the restaurant so beware. But it's not a problem inside.  It's not that fancy although it looks as so. I had on flip flops and didn't feel underdressed. Would easily come back  Go hungry!

uAOOrhYfr5dQbV8ax794kQ.text: I was a little surprised to find a Shula's Steak House in the casino that I was staying. The people that we were meeting during our stay had made reservations for our first night in AZ so my body thought it was 10:30 pm before we were seated. I generally don't eat at steak houses as the good ones are very expressive and the moderately priced one sometimes provide less than quality steak.  The service throughout the meal was good...not great. Food kept coming out of the kitchen at a decent pace and the drinks were refilled quite well. I must say that the Kansas City strip steak that I order was cooked and seasoned very well and 3 other steaks ordered at out table were prepared well; however, one of the filets order at the table was just mutilated (too late to send back). My wife and I shared a side dish of spinach and au gratin potatoes. The spinach had way too undercooked garlic on it and the potatoes were an initial "no show". When the au gratin potatoes showed up, they were tasty but runny.  All in all, the wine was good. The majority of our protein was cooked appropriately. The side dishes could use a little work. The food itself is probably a 4, but for the price, the noise and the kitchen errors, the experience was a 3.

KApqR88w1WxWZJHDQa6JSg.text: I tried the Twin Lobster Tails, Surf and Turf, and 24oz Porter House as a main course. I have to say that regardless of the high quality service, Shula still doesn't have much of the potentials to win me.   I like how they do a short presentation before serving and taking orders, and the whole dining experience makes me feel like an upper class diner. However, the lobster tails don't have that much flavors, as well as the steak - even though it was nicely cooked.  This is somewhat an upscale restaurant, I will revisit, but not on the regular time frame.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Twin Lobster Tails

-QOUK5CANVTZb3Qwr59umg.text: We first went to one in Florida it was outstanding so we went to the one here and Phoenix and bam! Amazing as usual. Prime rib was perfect.  Service great. Nice ambiance too.  And when I had breakfast at the Florida one I had the best damn bacon of my life.  And I'm not usually a meat person but wow!!!

7aMOF-98KcNLF--vSakFtA.text: My husband and I went here for first anniversary and we couldn't be more happier. The food was fantastic! All of their meat is extremely high-quality and you get the meal that you pay for. I can't speak enough for how fantastic the staff is! All of them were super friendly and charming. They made the evening not only fun but magical. I really like how the sides were big enough to share so each person didn't have to order their own side. Because it was her anniversary they even gave us a free dessert of a multiple layer chocolate cake that was just incredible! We also had a few the cocktails (I had a Mojito, and my husband had the whiskey sour) which were super yummy very well with the meal. I have to say my husband's whiskey sour was one the best I've ever sipped. Don't let the fact that the steakhouse is in a casino fool you. It is one of the nicest places you can get a stick of the valley and worth the trip just outside of town to go and have a lovely evening even if you do not plan to gamble. Thank you Shula for a wonderful evening!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Rib eye in front of me, husband had the filet mignon, we shared the steamed asparagus with hollandaise sauce

ZiNBS3POiK9NarjXW7bdcw.text: Best steakhouse in the valley.  True " prime" steaks.  Better than Dominic's, Morton's, and Mastro's.  Matt Davis is a fantastic Manager/Coach.  Brian, Linda, and Jennifer are some of the best servers we've ever encountered.  Be sure to check Shula's Steakhouse out for a memorable dining experience.

21UO7Z_LqTaPqEwgXCb4UA.text: We went to celebrate our birthdays which are 2 days apart. We were greeted by a pleasant staff and seated in a side booth which was great for a sense of privacy but proved likely to be a problem. The food is very good but a bit pricey in my opinion. We ordered crab cakes which were good but not comparable to those from visits to Baltimore. The sea scallops were prepared well. It's a steak house and I suggest stick to steaks. I would have given more stars but for the very poor service. We were in a side booth  and felt forgotten. Never once did anyone check back with us. When we finished we waited  over 10 minutes for anyone to notice we were done. The waitstaff were abrupt and seemed rushed. I will say this  is quite different from past experiences here where the attentiveness of the staff was a big part of our decision to return. A small issue was that when our server initially meet us he offered a complimentary  free piece of "birthday" cake but we only received one. Not a big issue but a reflection of the lack of interest or attention to US by service staff.

vlrQZxxHFVyaiFTDYmQpHg.text: Great food, great service. We had a work group and a large table. They were great at getting our food and drinks out at the same time which is rare with over 10 people. Everything I ordered was really good. Their sides are huge!! I recommend sharing. The twice baked potato was great, the Brussels sprouts were my favorite side dish, I'll be craving those for sure and the filet mignon trio and will order it again. Our servers were great too. Alejandro had me laughing all night and made good recommendations. All in all it was a great night. I will be back.

25pzo_zkZQ1KldQ13Q9bcA.text: Booo! Horrible experience. Whoever took my reservations in the afternoon made a mistake (made it for the next day). When I showed up, the place was packed. All 3 hostesses just sat there and played dumb... no apologies, nothing. Great job, you three!!!

zH8fivQtIuqLlCPdzyukTA.text: You can only hope the song and dance about the 72 dolphins hasn't been going on for the past 39 years, very cheesy for a "high end" restaurant.  This isn't the HOF we are here to eat.  BTW, nice footie ball on my plate but remind me why something that is tossed or kicked is on my plate?  The service was excellent the food is expensive and very so-so.  Appetizers were okay and definitely not memorable.  My medium-rare Kansas City cut was way over done, there is no going back to a steakhouse that can't figure out how to cook a steak, the side dish of crab mac'n cheese was tepid.

zKBnYMjofbb3qZ7UJeCnzQ.text: I've been to this place several times and I've never left impressed (besides for the bill).  It's too expensive for what you get but still a decent steak house.   It's also good for business or for not steak lovers (eaters with not-so-high expectations).  For a staycation with a date would work good as well.  I wouldn't drive more than 4 miles to go there and for that money you can do way way better.  Cheers

Q1F-yU3V8Dhxpp8jAL2elg.text: Come every year for my birthday and have not been disappointed!!! The steaks are fabulous from the 48 ounce monster porterhouse to the divine fillets, Plus the sides are to die for. crab mac & cheese forget about it!!! Seafood sampler appetizer is out of this world.

d6qY_pbV2Dz0-mYoaa_71A.text: Nice place. It's cool that you can see all that football memorabilia from Shula's dolphin years. They even put a football on your table with their meat menu on it. Pretty cool. Had a great filet! And the crab Mac & cheese is awesome! Some premium oysters on a half shell too!

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States

DxNVQwmy-jLiaoJwzlLXwQ.text: This restaurant has scrumptious menu items, but their customer service is horrendous. I come for the delicious menu creations, but always leave feeling that my business wasn't appreciated.   A+ for the chefs  F on customer service.

0pV0rhZIoOCrtXegPPk1SA.text: For the price, we expected much better. It is very disappointing when you go to a highly rated place and you can prepare the food better at home. We were there for a friend's birthday in the private dining room. Both the chicken and steak (filet) were dry and not flavorful.  The side dishes of mushrooms and mashed potatoes were just okay and the chocolate birthday cake was very dry.  The service was slow.  We would not come here again.

vS8h_tn3KuC39MRfKfNf5g.text: I went to Shula's for a small dinner party for a friend's 40th birthday on 09.04.12..  As we arrived, I noticed a sign "still undefeated."  Well, Shula's lost that evening because the service was dreadful, now they're 14 - 1.    The waitress was nice and knew the birthday boy and his girlfriend from past dinners.  Honestly, I believe the poor service was not her fault.  Instead, it was the back-end staff's inability to deliver our orders in a timely manner and their inability to deliver what we ordered.  We placed two orders of the crab mac-n-cheese and we had to ask an additional two times for the food.    The food was still very good, but for close to a million dollars a plate, I was expecting better service.  I will keep giving my business to Durants.    Go Raiders!

PgzmbFcaxtHLxGvzRaLFWQ.text: My first experience with a Shula's.  I had a birthday free meal and my friends were game for a pricey meal for a change.  Two ordered the trio and had crab cakes, steak and scallops.  A month later they are still raving about the scallops.  They'd do the trio again but get double scallops instead of the crab cakes that were not exciting.  Since the fish special was sea bass and suppose to be good (it was), I got that and shared with a friend that had the trio so I got to try the fabulous scallops.  Of course, after reading the review about the sandy scallops I'm am kinda fearful of our next experience there.  My other friend got the ribeye which is one of her favorites there (she's a regular).  I wanted one of the chocolate desserts that you need to order during dinner, but my friend said they had outstanding creme brulee which is my favorite.  Big mistake, they don't have regular vanilla.  They offer a trio with two having liqueur flavors and won't let you have 3 vanilla.  So no dessert for me....or so I thought.  Because it was my birthday they brought me a piece of awesome chocolate cake.  So big and rich I took most of it home.   Service was good, we seemed to have 3 people taking care of us.  Even though we've gotten away from $100 meals...I can see us returning.

UQyCboOV-JyIICcwOa12uQ.text: Fine dining...sort of? If you're not familiar, this place is the chain from Don Shula the famous football coach. The prices are up there with some of the other big name steak houses, Delmonico's, Morton's Ruth's Chris, etc. We were staying at the hotel so we tried it.   It's fine dining service, very professional, mixed with a fantasy football man-cave. Steak menu written on a football in the middle of the table and wall to wall football photos.   The service was excellent. I wasn't impressed with the food at all. Tasteless. From beginning to end. The only thing that stood out is the fried squid. Good appetizer that I can get at TGI Fridays. Steak was cooked right, it just wasn't all that good. Desert was terrible. For nearly $300.00 it isn't worth it. I realize if you're stuck in the hotel, you don't really have that many choice but there is a mall just down the street surrounded by better restaurants. The cab fair is worth it to find a better place to dine.

Up-DyEgBcSZdW6TonFq18w.text: I'm going to start off buy saying I'm not a steak person.  So why was I at Shula's?  I was attending a vendor dinner, got the invite and couldn't turn down an offer for a ridiculously priced dinner and ...I love football so you can see the connection.    The football memorabilia was plentiful.  They even put an autographed football/menu on your table for a short time.    Our server, totally scripted in reading off all about the steaks, thanks for the meat lesson by the way, was very nice and totally handled our party of seven.    I ended up getting the crab cakes.  They were worth every penny.  Probably better than any seafood place back home.  I had a side salad and we ordered the crab and cheese macaroni, asparagus, and potatoes as sides.    I also indulged in the cherry noir martini, I even had two!  Very good.    Overall, very good dining experience.  I just don't see myself paying for this type of meal on my own.

KxwsX4siF0QHLnr-ZzV0Uw.text: I can't believe all the negative comments. I must have went on a great night then! Our service was excellent! Lobster bisque was amazing and my 6oz steak was cook perfectly at medium well and melted in my mouth. Twice baked potato with white cheddar was fantastic! It is definately big enough to share between two people. Great wine as well. A little pricey but worth every penny!

z_nekOHUk2BBgAnsZJUMTw.text: I dined at Shula's for the first time tonight.  It was a disappointing experience as I had heard rave reviews from several casino patrons.  They need to get out more.  We were seated promptly and greeted by our waiter shortly after.  Our waiter noted that there would be 3 servers tending to us.  I would have been have with one.  We were ignored.  Our water and iced tea went unfilled as did our bread.  The prices at Shula's warrant attention to their guests.  We received very little.  Our steaks were very good and cooked as we ordered the.  The bread and salads were good.  I found the mashed potatoes to be bland and forgettable.  The corn and asparagus were good.  Though I know the prices are a bit less than City Hall, I would rather pay the difference for the attention to detail and better food.

4K-dudtDOhLC7V4O-DYEhw.text: Service was good, food not to par with the prices.  Steak was good, little dry, lobster tail was very good.  The bacon bits on the wedge salad tasted like the the kind that came out of a jar. Ordered the BBQ shrimp and they were horrible, they had a nasty tasting BBQ sauce on them, total waste.   At the end of the day, it is a "steakhouse" in a casino and just not that great and prices just to high.  You can pay the same for Flemings or Ruth Chris and get much tastier food.

3dU5vpfvNm62mqPxEc-_OA.text: Hands down best steakhouse in AZ !!!! Well worth the drive but if you're planning a stag cation defiantly book a room ! There's so much to do on this resort. I've personally been coming for years and can't get enough ! I'm not a gambler but their casino is nice and very clean compared to the rest of the casinos in Phoenix. Not to mention the hotel rooms are gorgeous with views of Phoenix landscape !

XfZU3GPsNczugb8b-vKJUA.text: As someone who prefers a well done-absolutely no pink steak, I am so thankful I can eat at shulas. I ordered a 16 oz New York strip well done, and it was amazing. The server did warn me that it would take about 30 minutes, because they do not butterfly cut the steak. This is fine because j appreciate that they want to do it right. My steak was juicy, buttery and SO TENDER. So great considering all other steakhouses just char a steak til it's bone dry. Love this place.

EsCLyBBhelVcRWJY2f1-tw.text: Very overpriced for the quality of the food. Ceaser salad was good and the desert was nice but everything in between was a mess.  Prime rib was bland and mostly chewy gristly slop, the included yorkshire pudding was tough like old shoe leather. The crab mac & cheese was extremely fishy tasting and smelling, none of us ate more than a bite of it... and the potato gratin was an oily mess. Everything was heavily crusted with bread crumbs. How can any decent restaurant screw up potatoes??  First and last time I'll ever try a Don Shula's. You can get a meal that's 10x as good at almost 1/2 the price at Flemings, or go to Donovan's and get a fantastic meal at the same price point, with much better ambiance and service.  My expectations were obviously way to high for a steak joint in a casino.

mIhSUA8xmG0IjJw9-YVMcw.text: My husband and I spent our 28 th anniversary here. To start with the overall experience was wonderful. The wait staff was extremely attentive friendly and informative. As far as the food was concerned the experience was started when we were served our bread basket filled with the most delicious sour dough bread we have ever tasted!! My wife ordered pan seared scallops with an add on of crab legs!  And I ordered the 12 oz bone in filet. Both entrees were cooked exactly to order. Very flavorful and prepared with just the right amount of seasonings. For our side dishes we ordered the crab Mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes. Both side were absolutely delicious and clearly enough to be shared by two. If you go to Shulas you've got to order the crab Mac and cheese!!!!  Sooooo good!! Dessert wa also awesome. Trio crime brulee was delicious. We will be back very soon!!!

gf8qv3Q4SNwGdawnA5R8Gw.text: Glad I had a casino comp. Would not have been happy to pay for this.  Service was great, but food was not.  Steak was dry.  Took home cheesecake - completely dry. Supposed to be accompanied by a coulis sauce. Not so much.

mJ8pMb5oPEKK6gbTEV8hDg.text: Nine of us had dinner and I was under-impressed.  initial greeting by staff was nice, seemed to be lots of attention as you would expect.  I had a bone in filet that was excellent and we ordered seafood appetizers that were good.  shortcoming was in the delivery of our entrees - 9 people, one server plus a helper took three trips to the kitchen to get all entrees down, not what I expect in any restaurant particularly one where entrees begin in the mid $40's.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. bone-in filet excellent

IYmdiNsp7p_4jbFbRa5wDQ.text: Amazing establishment with such class and quality food and drinks! Hosted my husbands company management dinner at Shula's so we had a private room and custom 3 course menu. With your choice of filet, salmon, or chicken. Starter salads and yummy dessert. Our staff was on top of our drinks and got everyone's order correct. The food was amazing or cooked to perfection. The drinks and wine list was amazing and the service was wonderful. Definitely worthy of 5 stars! We will definitely be back again and again.

-tPhI00inFAFMkD1JIP-gA.text: Ridiculous, you have to have a reservation prior to Friday or weekends because they get busy. So we put in for a seating and decided to come back in the hour. Initially we weren't told about a hat rule but I was was wearing a cabbie hat and told to take it off after we were seated. To spend that kind of money and be told what to wear is beyond me, not to mention not being told when initially reserved the seating the first time.  Me and wife left after talking to the manager and he mentioned there are certain circumstances that are considered, that a hat like mine he would accept.  Regardless I think it's bullish!t coming in and willing to pay that kind of money to eat or drink to be told to remove your hat. I wasn't dressed outlandish and I get restaurants can refuse services based on certain circumstances but this was surprising especially because it was in a Casino setting.  Definitely won't be back even if I'm not wearing a hat.

Zr5NVw3sctCXDFZ8mFMG9Q.text: 2.5* rounded up for service & food only.   We have dined at Shula's on numerous occasions, always enjoying the atmosphere, food, and service. Scott chose it for his 50th Birthday dinner last night, and we were both looking forward to this very special occasion.   The Hostess Brianna was lovely and welcoming, the "Happy Birthday" sign at the table was a nice touch. Shula's is dimly lit, with the usual clubby motif present in many steakhouses. Brian was our server: he is charming, knowledgeable, professional, and was a pleasure all evening; his team kept water and iced tea glasses full, cleared dishes quickly, used the crumb catcher, offered fresh cracked pepper, and brandy for lobster bisque; the truly lovely serving assistant (I forget her name, because of an ongoing disturbance I was distracted) was delightful, she even offered to remove my lobster tails from the shell.   Since we have been here more than a half dozen times, we knew what we wanted: I had the Very Dirty Belvedere Martini up with blue cheese stuffed olives, it was only my second cocktail since July, and it was perfect! A nibble of the bread and quality butter almost made me eat more, but I refrained. We both started with lobster bisque: mine with brandy added tableside, Scott's without: I enjoyed it quite a bit while Scott found it too salty; the serving assistant noticed, and wrapped it up for me to-go. This is when another party nearby became rambunctious, and where the evening turned...  An adjacent table with a large party was quite loud, at first it wasn't terrible, but in short order one inebriated woman yelling, making strange noises (bird calls? drunk ass hoots, I dunno) and was dropping Fbombs, the rest of the party was loud, but not vulgar. Scott is a very calm person and was beginning to get upset: he asked if I'd like to move, which I declined because I was sure the party would be asked to leave, moved, or at least STFU. Our server assistant and Brian tried to ensure we enjoyed our meal - our shared wedge salad was classically perfectly executed, my twin lobster tails, Scott's filet mignon, and both the grilled asparagus and mushroom sides were all delicious - but, accompanied by the cacophony of the whole party nearby, it was not enjoyable. Scott was visibly upset during the remainder of the meal, most of which we took to-go. Shortly before the decadent and very kind gesture of complimentary seven layer chocolate cake - with a  candle - and light, tasty cheesecake arrived, the loudest "neighbor" started arm wrestling whilst cursing and generally being a nuisance. I've never experienced this in a fine dining setting, and I lived in Las Vegas for 12 years!   We settled our check, thanked Brian, and as we left, we spoke to the Manager. We had seen her on the floor, and she had visited our neighbors when Drunky Drunkerson was loudly bellowing for more booze. As we were talking to her, one of our "neighbors" loomed in a menacing manner next to Scott. At this point, I'd have gladly cleaned his clock for ruining Scott's birthday. I just wanted to leave, the Manager was kind, but her answer was basically: she was overserved before arrival elsewhere. We did see the woman with a beer, but that really wasn't the point. I feel this could and should have been handled much, much better by management. My birthday is next week, and I won't even bother to use my Shula's free entree coupon. It will be a long while before we return. This was $225 and an evening better spent elsewhere. The only thing that saved this from 2* is Brian and his team's service, and the always enjoyable food.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Why I should not be allowed to order after skipping lunch 9.28.27 = Lobster for breakfast, FTW!
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. To-go 9.28.17
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. We took so much leftover food to-go! 9.28.17

x4DxwVefPs6JQ5lGAm2SFw.text: Had a great first experience.  The atmosphere is very nice, quaint with a higher class sports theme as you would expect for a place named Shula's.  Service was top notch, friendly, professional and very attentive.  Pricing is typical for a higher end steak house.  Great appetizers and a very diverse menu with great bar selections as well.  My only regret is this place isn't in a stand alone building and is in the casino, I'm not a fan of Indian Gaming.  Thanks for an enjoyable evening, we will return.

F9oNVBRmH_dkxYb-zEak5g.text: 2.5 Stars  My wife took me there for my birthday back in June. Food was good but we had a few other issues (forgot items on order, abandoned service, etc.) from which they sent us a gracious $100 gift card. this is the only reason we returned. I won't get into those details.   As far as our experience going back on Nov 13th to use the previous mentioned gift card....mediocre at absolute best! I ordered the 22oz cowboy ribeye with a twice baked potato and my wife decided on the ahi tuna and crab mac n cheese for dinner.   The steak: My "prime cut, aged ribeye" was more like a frys choice ribeye, which I can cook better than the one I had here. When you age a steak it breaks down muscle tissue enhancing the tenderness and natural beef flavor. That was NOT the case with this steak. I cut my wife a piece to try because I wanted her opinion and I exaggerate you not she discarded the steak into her napkin. Granted I cut her another piece and she said "it's ok but you can do better with a store bought steak." The steak was flavorless (even though I ordered blackened with heavy seasoning - I learned from the last trip) and I won't go as far as saying tough, but it sure wasn't prime aged tender by any means.  The twice-baked potato: I think it may have been thrice-baked. It was drier than a popcorn fart. Good thing I had a cold beer to wash it down. Nothing else to say about that.  The seared ahi: Cold, flavorful, cooked perfect and delicious. Plain and simple. I'm not sure how you could mess this one up though.  The crab mac n cheese:If I was able to swim in this bowl of amazing creation I would have. Big lumps of crab meat, creamy cheese, amazing noodles = heaven in a bowl.  Conclusion: Bottom line is I came here for a prime-cut, aged, tender, juicy steak. I got a less than mediocre, mostly flavorless, not tender, choice quality cut of ribeye beef. This steak alone was $48 in itself. I can do much better for much cheaper at T*xas Ro*dhouse. I damn near ordered the 48oz porterhouse too. I was a hungry man. Sure glad I didn't waste my time on that. The wifes meal was the star. My meal, well, you can see how I felt about spending that kind of money on it. I gave it a 2nd try and can say it was my last. Too many other great options in the Phoenix area to waste anymore time at this one.  You fumbled Shulas. I recovered and I'm taking it straight to another house.

2VLUmKUSyKVaamSn7FuM9w.text: Had an excellent meal with very good service. The reason for only 4 stars is that your choice of side (and they are great choices) are a seperate cost making the cost of your favorite cut a little pricey.

LTKDTkj6eu-mlpAXirUgIg.text: Loved shulas! Amazing! Great food! Great experience will be back!! Great steaks! Wonderful food!

ocEdu5TYNSmrO1ZmG_cqzQ.text: A bit pricey. However, be prepared to be pampered with service and atmosphere. Intimate setting and great food. The steak filets are outstanding as is the two baked potatoes. The staff is professional but friendly. You pay more but its worth the experience and superior food taste and choices. No discounts.

sdwLrxEXv3MnWC2yZe_arw.text: My family and I ate dinner at Shulas, OH.MY.GOODNESS! I have never tasted anything so exquisite. We ordered the Calamari fries and Crab Cake for an appetizer, I have one word for you...DELICIOUS! Our Steaks were the best we have ever had, and the Scallops were as smooth as butter. The staff was very professional and knowledgeable, everyone should try Shulas for a delicious experience. I will leave you with this...the twice baked potato and the Mac n cheese should be illegal. Shulas is top notch, and worth every dollar. If you are looking for a classy restaraunt, and you are tired of paying for reheated, frozen food, go to Shulas at Wild Horse Pass you will not be disappointed!

DKx9-X44miGWGB9DmF0P9w.text: Their story and history got them 3 stars. I wasn't very impressed. My wife liked the lobster Mac n cheese.

KvNCbZMyqm9mocUXAaKkqA.text: I was pleasantly impressed with my entire dining experience. Kudos to management for training the discrete up-sale on everything. I consider myself picky and everything I had from the butter to the fresh-baked hot sourdough bread and the crab mac & cheese were all five stars. I can't wait to go back! Their football motiff is a fun touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Crab Mac and Cheese $13

TxIQ0YJrfpwGg_PrBIcZCg.text: This restaurant is in the middle of the casino, so if you're there to gamble and then have an elegant dinner, this is the place. The food tends to be pretty pricey, but you're paying partly for the name and the ambience. But, the food is very good and there is a very wide selection of wines.

Aigd5Rktx0XnUlu5Fadu8Q.text: Shout out to Alejandro. Try to sit in Alejandro's section; you won't be disappointed. He knows the menu inside and out, he will tell it like it is, and he is very entertaining. The food was 5 stars, but Alejandro deserves an extra star for the incredible service. Try the mixed grill of scallops, filet, and fish.  And the creme brule trio is out of this world.  My husband and I don't smoke and don't gamble, but we will gladly walk through the casino lobby to the restaurant. There is no smoke odor at all. Don't be put off by the fact that it's in a casino. It's a gem. Weve been here a few times; the food and service are always top notch. We'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Crab cake, filet, and scallops. Delish!

aqWnjEtBfG6MQmc6vUiqXg.text: My husband and I have been here about 5 times over the last few years and has never disappointed. The food is amazing! Their bread is the best I've had in my life. This is the only place I will eat steak and the lava cake....wow. I wish I could afford to eat here more!   PS make a reservation!

YZ-cJENkKmryiRep6DfjCA.text: This was a nice treat!! We were there to celebrate my birthday - if you sign up for their emails, they give you a free birthday entree which is a great deal as this place is a bit pricey. Of course my certificate was received one day too late, but we will just have to return :) The French onion soup lived up to the hype! My husband ordered a 12 oz filet which was phenomenal, could have cut it with a fork it was so tender. I ordered the peppercorn chicken, and thankfully they serve the sauce on the side because it was not my favorite. This chicken and the potatoes au gratin were sadly bland, not "bad" but lacked depth of flavor. The chicken is split with the bones in it, and had a nice crusty skin, so I was surprised when it didn't have a lot of flavor going on. The truffle fries were sooo good, really glad we ordered them and would do it again. The bread is also very tasty and they serve a huge portion. I couldn't make it through my meal so I skipped desert, next time!  Some reviews have mentioned parking being rough, but I didn't think it was bad, free parking garage close by. The worst part is walking through clouds of smoke on the Casino floor to get to the rear of the building and up the escalator to Shula's. They can't help that, but it is annoying to walk through that on the way to a fancy meal.

ALNORn7T4HVA9ZsDJ_GWGA.text: We are not picky at all, so it takes a lot to disappoint us. But we were disappointed. We knew it was going to be crazy expensive...but hopefully worth it...Nope.  Calamari appetizer was TERRIFIC! Highly recommend. Steak was ok...much better at Carabbas or Outback. Chicken was good but bland. Lobster bisque was REALLY GOOD! Corn GOOD but only if you like a lot of bacon.  Creamed spinach GOOD. Ambiance was neat,typical steak house decor, cool with all of the football pictures and stuff.   Won't return, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse wins hands down!!!!

KMaKlb38OtnyCmc8ybnqPQ.text: We were there having thanksgiving dinner but ordered off the menu instead of their thanksgiving meal. The Sea Bass lacked flavor but the scallops were delicious. The desserts were also excellent. The reason for the low rating was due to main entrees not accompanied by enough sides. You have to order individual sides like cream spinach, asparagus or any starch. By end of day, you end up having to order 3 or 4 items for one meal.  Service was great but you have to walk through the casino up the escalator to get there.

497lGensNQb_E2WZYiHIZw.text: Went here for a client dinner and it was fabulous!   I'm always a little skeptical when dining someplace where someone has their name on a restaurant outside of Vegas, but I was so pleasantly surprised!  The waitstaff was a little slow for having two servers wait on each table. Surprisingly slow. I sat with my oyster plate in front of me long after I was finished. Same thing with my salad plate (both were obviously finished). I actually had to call the waitress over because it was beginning to get ridiculous. It still took a few more minutes to get it out from under me though.  The bread they serve is a warm sourdough (or some variation thereof) and was so soft and delicious. The butter on it made me feel like it was all I needed to be completely happy as a meal.   I ordered the Blue Point oysters and they were of course delicious. They didn't offer any horseradish which I thought was strange, but I didn't need it anyway. My customer ordered the seared ahi tuna and I didn't like it nearly as much. It tasted a little dry, but he seemed to enjoy it.   I also ordered the house salad and it was probably the best I've ever had. It had artichoke, tomatoes and cucumbers and tasted so fresh that I could have sworn they picked it out of the garden for me. I loved this.   For dinner I ordered salmon and asked for it grilled. It came out perfectly cooked and flaky with a beautiful pink color. It was very good. As a side I ordered grilled asparagus which was a great accompaniment.   My customer ordered the chilean sea bass. It was actually much better than I thought it would be, I just had a little bite, but I would definitely try it if I go back.   For dessert we decided to share the very chocolatey  souffle. When it came out it had fallen and was undercooked so they brought us this huge slice of chocolate cake. The first bite I knew it was frozen. I asked and they confirmed that while it was made at the corporate office it was still frozen. This is my biggest pet peeve. Fine restaurants should NEVER serve frozen cake, it's disgusting. I'm surprised more people don't complain because it was just so...fake. We ignored it.   One last thing, while we were there the comedian playing next door, Ron White, wanted to dine here. The waiter came over (our other one) and said that he would be sitting next to us and to please not disturb him. I thought it was pretty tasteless to think I'd interrupt my not-so-cheap meal in order to gawk at and fawn over some cut-rate comedian playing a casino. Not classy at all.   The food here is incredible, I highly recommend it, just don't expect phenomenal service to go with that.

O-T2_2KHmpN4tDyGxnaC2g.text: The food here is the star of the show. The quality of beef is fantastic. The lobsters were meaty, well flavored, and perfectly prepared.  The service is where they lost a couple of stars. Our server was very knowledgeable and professional, but seemed irritated that we showed up at 10:20pm (they closed at 11) despite having called ahead to make sure this wouldn't be an issue.  The first patron to order in our group ordered the porterhouse, medium with a baked potato and a lobster tail. The second patron said, "I'll have that exact same thing, except medium rare on that steak." I was third in the group, and asked for the same as well, except with a rare steak. The first two orders were delivered with a baked potato, and mine was absent. The waiter claimed that he didn't hear me ask for a baked potato until I reminded him that both of us ordered the same as the first patron. He remembered, and apologized, but informed me that they didn't have any more potatoes. Oh well. They looked good, anyways. ;-)
