Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Oyster appetizer. HUGE oysters, very fresh and delicious.

Rlz7qnu6XvjWuHzDQpKIXQ.text: Ate at the bar and Robert the bartender was fantastic. Food was great. We had the French onion soup and lobster bisque. Then shared the black and blue salad (burnt tips) with blue cheese dressing. Service was impeccable as was the bread they import from Virginia then finish here with butter. Will be back!

RnuV_YMT0UMoZHveBatzSg.text: Our two visits have been fantastic!  Service was friendly, attentive and quick. Prime Rib was cooked perfectly and the au jus was very flavorful! The 22 oz cowboy ribeye was great too.  Sides are all a la carte. Lobster mac and cheese or Lobster mashed potatoes  - both hit the spot.   Is it pricey? Oh yes. It is. Yet, for us it was worth the splurge!

uTc_e273e76uTE-q3WdJSQ.text: We made reservations at Shula's Steak House for our Christmas Eve dinner.  We were there 10 minutes before our reservation time and were seated right away.  A server didn't appear at our table for at least 15 minutes.  Finally he took our drink order and we ordered an appitizer.  The appitizer came out 20 minutes later however, we still didn't have our drinks and the server had never returned to take our order.  We ate our appitizer which was very tasty and finally the server came back to take our order.  We expressed how long it was taking and he told us it would be better for us to leave and not to worry about the appitizer.  It seemed he was glad to get rid of our table.  Very dissappointing as it was a special time for our family to get together...

9rCv3-hZi6XvWbH1H7lFwg.text: This experience was the worst I have ever had. Table of 11 and over 1000.00 bill. The servers were very rude and never checked on the table to offer additional drinks or water unless we asked. Spoke to the manager after waiting two hours to be served dinner. Manager Never made an attempt to expedite the service nor did he come over to the table to apologize or see if the experience improved.  If you want a great steak for 50.00 I recommend not going to Shula's. The experience is Overpriced with horrible service.

HpJihi4jR1tk0pdOvcq4pQ.text: Our recent dinner at Shulas steak house was very dissapointing. The service was far below par and our steaks were very overcooked and dry. The steak fries we ordered didn't come when the meal was served, when we told the waitress they didnt come until we were almost finished with the meal. There was also a drunk out of control guy at the table next to us. Will not be dining at Shul's any time soon there are many nicer places to eat in phoenix.

qGozFSLUEMq6glEu_R_sxw.text: My boyfriend took me here recently before seeing a show at the casino, it was our first time dining at Shula's. Overall, we enjoyed our dinner and would go again if we were staying at Wild Horse.   Details... The bread was hot and good. We started with the Ceasar salad, but as another reviewer experienced, even though we told our waitress we were going to split it, they brought out the salad and an extra plate. We agreed that they should have split the salad for us; it wasn't that big of a deal, but for a nice restaurant I was surprised. The Ceasar was just OK, the croutons were soggy but it wasn't drowning in dressing so that was good.     I ordered the 8oz filet ($38), my bf had the surf-and-turf ($75), and we split the lobster mashed potatoes and the creamed spinach. After reading earlier reviews I was nervous about how our steaks would come out after seeing so many had problems with over or under done steaks. I tried to order my steak "medium rare plus, so between medium rare and medium" the waitress said they couldn't do that...what?! So I just went with medium and kept my fingers crossed it would be ok. Lucky for me, the steak came out perfect BUT if I was a person that liked my steak a True medium it would have been very under done. My boyfriend also ordered his steak medium and it came out the same, we agreed it definitely was not a medium steak. But that was just fine with us, they were perfectly done and very tender, not one bad bite. Steaks came with bernaise sauce which was a nice surprise, I hardly used it though because the steaks were so tasty (although a bit salty) on their own.  My bfs lobster tail was cooked perfect and there was some seasoning on it already, so you didn't even need to dip it in butter.   We both did not care for the lobster mashed potatoes, I would have preferred plain mashed potatoes. There was big chunks of lobster, which was nice, but there was a funky gravy on top that I didn't like. The creamed spinach was very good. Not too creamy and swimming in cheese or cream, just enough, so you could still taste the spinach.    I would go again if we were staying at the Wild Horse hotel, but not go out of our way to dine at Shula's. For an expensive meal like that I would hope for great not just very good.

7wR7XQAhE74NyastqcTcoQ.text: Poor service and all 7 of our steaks were literally cold when the finally came out. Will never go back. Ruth Cris is 10x better.

HaXP2dEFYNAWyPyoYQmJUQ.text: The meal my husband and I ate here was not the most expensive we've ever shared but it was biggest waste of money. We left feeling that we had paid top dollar for mediocre food. Nothing was particularly bad, but I would say everything we ordered tasted like something you would eat at Chilli's or Applebees. Even the specialty cocktails were a big disappointment and very overpriced. As far as service goes, the hostess and our server were very friendly and accommodating but I have never experienced such slow service at a restaurant at this price point. We had to remind our server about missing items and wait about 20 minutes for him to bring the check. I did like the decor and thought that the football theme was fun but the way the tables are positioned makes the restaurant feel crowded even though it was not very full the night we went. The tables are also way too small to accommodate the way they serve the side dishes (family style). To sum up, even though I really wanted to like this place, it was not a good experience at all. Please save your money.  We went for my husband's birthday dinner because it is close to where we live but I wish we would have just driven to Scottsdale and gone to Fogo de Chao.

Ik2VZ6dYyTpm8SKV783azQ.text: I wish "underwhelmed" was the best I could say about this place but a more honest impression would be supreme disappointment.  We were seated and ordered a $170 bottle of wine - it took 20 minutes for the server to come back and we didn't even get water in the meantime. I actually had to get up and find someone to pour us water. It apprently helps to be friends with or share pictures of your kids with the server to get assistance. I almost had a pitcher of ice in my lap while the table next to us had their water poured with a napkin as a splash guard.  The tomato/fresh mozzarella salad was sad...I would imagine better in a high school cafeteria. The tomatoes were white, not ripe and the balsamic dressing average. The 2 bright spots:  1)  the BBQ shrimp, though under cooked a bit, the fresh basil was a great burst of flavor combo with the BBQ sauce, 2) the grilled asparagus with balsamic reduction (sauce is not mentioned). The sides are not the portions you would anticipate - True servings for 2-3, a couple of bites for 4, and I really mean bites not heaping spoonfulls. The crab mac & cheese was decent for flavor but left both crab and cheese to be desired. The plates weren't hot, my medium-rare filet was barely warm and chewy with so-so flavor and cooked unevenly. My brother's porterhouse came rare not med-rare and was sent back. After 10 minutes we had to ask where it was (something about we all have pagers and they will let us know - but apparently there was a pager failure). It wasn't even worth trying desert the disappointment was too much to bear....I was embarassed to bring to my family here and pay so much for so little. For a place that boasts they "eat, breathe and sleep"  meat I would suggest that they go back to bed and you spend your money at any Mastro's, Capital Grill,  or even The Keg.

DRomV1xLcwib_uVOcmga9A.text: Thought I died and went straight to "The Best Steak Ever" heaven... seriously.  Menu was defininately pricey but worth every cent!  A la carte menu had plenty of salads and sides to add on but the 8 oz. filet I had was the real dream and it was cooked perfectly at medium rare (which the server had me check before he left the table).  My only wish for this place was that they had a larger bar area... only 5 seats.  It's upstairs on the second level of the casino so there was hardly any noise from all the slot machines below.  If you've got the cash, you certainly want to try this place!!

_Qy6kKJKrTIR66ZT6ReOhA.text: This was my first time to Shula's.  I was disappointed.  Service was sloppy.  The waitstaff stepped on themselves and tried to take our order twice.  They made a good martini.  My wedge was great.  My steak was overdone.  Most everyone at the table had issues with either overdone or underdone.  The mac and cheese was so so.

I0gdkG3Vf_YObKmE-WS-3g.text: Never been to a Shula's Steakhouse and friend said her husband took her there last year and it was amazing. Better than Ruths, Mortons, you name it.  Five of us girls went on a Saturday night and spent over 2.5 hours at dinner, with drinks food and dessert.  It was one of the best meals I have ever had and the service was top notch.

vsvf2kLaiX3vuCRb7D3tIg.text: Although the food was quite good, I must say that never in all of my vast dining experiences have I had such a ridiculous encounter. The general manager, Bob, attempted to seat the three of us at a table that was crowded with other diners, while the other end of the restaurant was empty. One of our party members is hard of hearing, so we requested to sit in a quieter spot. Bob almost broke down in tears and pleaded, "Can we just stick with the plan?" So we were seated at his original choice. The reservation was for 3 - I have the email comfirmation from Open Table, and he whined that the place setting was only for two and "how come we had three people?" Shocked - we sat down to view our menus. Now here comes the really amazing part. There were only 2 menus for the three of us. I called him over and asked if I could have another menu. His words exactly - "When there are three people at a table and one is part of a couple, we only give two menus." Then he proceeded to stare at me. I told him that I was NOT going to share a menu, and he ran off to retrieve one for me. Had we not been going to see the BB King concert at the venue next door, we would have left immediately. Never have I heard of such a thing. This man is clearly not suited to deal with the public or have anything occur "outside the plan". Completely bizarre and we will not go back.

5MhysbpF3K1aohcnpANGhA.text: we went to this location for valentines day this year . i was truly impressed while the prices ar steep i cal fully say that they are worth it. dinner seemed like a well orchistated event . every thing times perfectly. the wait staff seems to be there to do a job only and they do leave u alone to enjoy ur meal. i look forward to returning to shulas in july

zoCzeH0_l00a7kAinyJ-Kg.text: I gave this four stars only because we've been twice prior and have absolutely loved it. If I was grading on this visit alone I would have awarded three stars. We went to Shula's for my birthday dinner, which included a free entree.  The dinner was amazing with one exception...MY ENTREE.  The service was fast and efficient, bread and wine were wonderful and the beefsteak tomato and gorgonzola salad was easily split by the two of us. The two tomato slices were huge and dominated the salad, so if you like that much tomato this is the salad for you. My wife thought it was spectacular; it was a little much for me. My wife ordered the special, which was a crusted Chilean Sea Bass and was absolutely perfectly prepared, while I ordered the 16 oz. New York Strip. At a quality restaurant my wife will normally order a seafood dish, I'll order a steak and we'll work the whole splitzy thing. When my steak was delivered they ask you to cut into the middle to determine if it is properly prepared. I always order my steak medium rare, so I cut into it and it was still raw in the middle. While they were putting the steak back on the grill my wife and I split the seabass and were amazed at how thick the cut of seafood was and how perfectly moist and flavorful it was served. I feared it might be undercooked in the middle due to its size, but the fear was unfounded. The steak was returned about half way through the seabass and I while it was now a perfect medium rare I could not believe how tough and bland it was. My wife commented when she saw me adding salt and pepper to the steak as I don't think I've ever had to add anything at a fine steakhouse. I told her to taste hers and she immediately had me pass the salt and pepper to her. Very disappointing. For a side we ordered the crab mac/cheese which is always a winner and tonight was no different. We rotate the side on our visits between the crab mac/cheese and lobster mashed potatoes and both are phenomenal. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the layered chocolate cake we had comped for my birthday as it was huge and we just took it to go. All in all we had an enjoyable dinner experience, but the weakest part of the meal should not be one of their signature steaks. From a meat standpoint I'll stick to either the filet or prime rib, both of which are top notch.

mjuTmtbVZel4-KS8WZczuQ.text: Totally overpriced and for what? Shula needs to go back to coaching, or try his food here.

sj9ly6mInhnXYG8LsSGARw.text: Went for our anniversary and it was perfect.  Servers Jen and Manny were professional and friendly. The food was cooked to perfection, we had the salmon and crab cakes. Service, atmosphere and food quality were great for the price.

8o96vcxeaMOuFTOqgsRF_w.text: Dude I don't even know how this place doesn't have an average rating of 5 stars.  Holy Jesus and Hallelujah this place is so insanely good my mouth is filling up with saliva as I write this. Not only are the servers attentive and obviously educated on the details and specifics of the menu, but not one has ever written down the order and messed it up at all, even a little.  By that I mean they remember the order without ever writing it down.  They get it right every time.  So basically I have four words for you FILET AND CRAB MAC.  Trust me as if I were your brain surgeon--you're going to want to get that crab mac and cheese.  And the portions are gigantic, easy split among even 3 people.  Yum and yum, check and mate.

oU0H2Nl7ddJaxm8FxDJweA.text: We were here to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary while staying at the hotel, This was not a good experience.  I don't ever fill out reviews but this one is necessary.  We waited for about 10 minutes to be seated even tho we had a reservation.  Service was slow.  Appetizers were pretty good so the food is getting a 2 star rating, but the entrees were terrible.  The chicken and steak were both overcooked, the twice baked potato was cooked probably 4 times and must have been sitting out since lunch because it was horrible.  The Brussels sprouts were decent.    During the meal, my wife looks down at her pants and sees that there is GUM stuck to both sides of her legs.  We pull up the table cloth and there is a huge spread of gum under the bottom of the table and the table cloth.  GROSS.  We let the server know, he said "oh sorry" and took off.  When he asked us for boxes because we barely ate our food, we told him how disappointing it was so we would not be taking it home.  He had no comment.  We ordered a dessert because we assumed they couldn't mess up, which was True, the chocolate cake was great.  But instead of comping us for the cake b/c our anniversary or the horrible experience we'd just had, he later delivered a piece of cold apple pie and said "happy anniversary" and charged us for the full meal.  On the way out we let an assistant manager know, she had no desire to make any of this right.  What a bummer of an experience!  $150 for a meal I wouldn't have paid $20 for.  Very disappointed.

y1Dr1g8Pja0DEvNP_cbsRg.text: Three stars is a fair rating here.  6 of us dropped $500 for average steak and sides. I guess when I go to this caliber of restaurant I want a bit of a wow factor. The biggest wow were the drinks at the bar before and that is not what we should be saying.  I do like the history and steak training they gave us, but I would have skipped it if we could have more impressive food Instead. Sorry Shula's, too many places to linger on your average food. If you do still insist on going then at least go for the ribeye. It by far was the best of the meals. Filets were not!

o1NojRgMv9apCW3p_DJW2w.text: Best steak in town! This place knows their meat and how to treat customers. It is located in the Wild House Pass casino, so although it is more of a fine dining restaurant, you can get a away with casual clothes.   My husband and I opted for the surf and turf (crab for me, lobster for him). Best crab- fresh and sweet. The best part is that the slice the crab legs for you, so you just have to pull the meat out!!!   Sides are al a cart, but big portions.  The wait staff was amazing and attentive. Highly recommend for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bbq bacon wrapped shrimp

8825rlmVxeiKEl_XbZVQiA.text: Bad all the way around. We tried something new but we will be sticking with Ruth's Chris or City Hall from now on.

uXPScKdv8ywKUowxPdahAA.text: Wow!  Can I say just Wow!  The meat was delicious, Melt in your mouth!  I'd have to say the best steak ever!  They have gluten free items as well including desserts!  We really enjoyed our visit!  The staff was amazing, they do a team approach.  I'm kind of drooling just thinking about it now!  We intend to try a weekend brunch in the future.  We heard they are going to be renovating into a larger space downstairs.

eXDn70SRr_MU9U_mf_TLKA.text: Was not expecting our experience here to be nearly as good as it was. We eat at a lot of steak restaurants and this was top 5 for sure! My husband got the Oscar style and he is obsessed. Worth every penny!

Mf65d7Rhjo0cp4zRDoi6YQ.text: This is my first time having a 24 oz prime rib. Needless to say, I could barely finished half of it. The service was outstanding and the restaurant is away from the smoky casino area. Our host, Matt, was super friendly and our waitress (I forgot her name) was extremely attentive. I did not care for the creamy horse radish sauce that it came with (I personality prefer the raw radish instead). It is a bit on the pricy side but definitely worth every penny. When I feel like having delicious steaks, I will most definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cowboy rib eye
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. 24oz prime rib

ctAaqSFu4HsjvPsgHvLAYw.text: Went last night for dinner. Early reservation 5:45, had an event after. So not to many people in there at that time. Hostess very nice. Got seated at a terrible your only a 2 top crap table. Once the server got to us and took our drink order it took awhile to get the drinks. Again not that many people in there. Fast forward....our server was not great. Not knowing questions that were asked, didnt check in, forgot to order side and sauce items. We had to flag her down to reorder drinks and practically beg for water. All in all very disappointing.  We have dined there 3 other times and it was great which is why we chose it, thinking not again. My filet was good my husband had the strip...not cooked right but did not send back cuz it would take another year to get it. Basically the horseradish was the best part of the meal.

YQt_Q9Q9aNR_efQK7PHVew.text: Expense account fare.  Not bad but not great.  Been to Shula's in Chicago and Orlando and both were exceptional, this one not so much.  Can't recommend

NsuPPPyIMlXXE5hl9ebNww.text: Stayed at resort for concert so convenient to dine at Shulas. Menu looked very nice and atmosphere is just lovely.service was excellent by Marko. Dinner all and all had a good start. Appetizers were good salads were good cocktails very nice. My husband and I both ordered the 16 ounce prime rib with Yorkshire pudding. Disaster. Total disaster. We have ordered prime rib many many times and I have never in my life not been able to cut a prime rib with a steak knife. It was ordered medium rare but we  couldn't cut it nor could we couldn't chew it. Besides the fact that the Yorkshire pudding was burnt to a crisp on the side of this I still can't get over the prime rib. I don't know how the cook served this. Marko was  wonderful about returning it and we ordered something else but I do have to admit this kind of spoiled the dinner. I've never returned anything this is actually my first time. I felt bad and doing it but it was in edible. I will not be returning to Shulas because of this.

6-TqDfiWhYnFMnbOiF_4sw.text: 3 stars overall experience with an additional star for the host. I think his name was Tim? He completely explained the history of the restaurant and why they have footballs all over the place. Great guy  The food was ok, not the best steak in the world but definitely not the worst. Ordered the New York steak, wife ordered the filet minion.. 3 out of 5 is suitable, but again an extra star for service.

KDXYvam1QAPJ8u4j1XtUvw.text: Celebrated my Mom's 70th Birthday at Shula's tonight. My husband ordered the surf and turf and said his filet mignonette was a bit dry. I had the wedge salad the best French Onion soup I've ever had! The flavor was superb! My mother had filet as well, and absolutely loved hers.   The ambiance and service was definitely five star quality. We will definitely be returning.

csmlh59CF5BSOP8qON2V9w.text: We have been coming to Shula's for years. When you sit down they give you a 10min speech about their quality. We would tell anyone who asked that Shula's has the BEST Lobster UNTIL TONIGHT! It was worse then any chain food Lobster. I understand that quality varies depends on region etc BUT if your gonna take 10 min out of my life to brag about your quality then do not serve that garbage. The worst part about it was that the manager agreed he was surprised at how bad the Lobster looked. When I said if you know it's not up to your standards why would you serve it he stated that they cannot make that call at the local level they are just a chain restaurant!!! Very disappointed in my $300 meal!!!

JOjnd8kwG0OUE-IKA0dAmA.text: We came here for our anniversary in April 2018. We shared a blue cheese crusted ribeye, and it was delicious!  The service was very friendly and professional. We'd definitely go here again.

X30PFisCaJL3897li62HoQ.text: The best steak I've ever had! I mean blow your taste buds away great! We Went for hubbies bday. They had a plaque  for him to celebrate, abd Gabe us the most amazing, rich, decedent, chocolate cake.  The atmosphere was wonderful.  Calm and  quiet and even though it was pretty busy it still felt intimate. The service was above and beyond, our drinks wether it was wine or water or just a beer were never empty.  Abby questions we had were answered knowledgeable. Cocktails were good, but a little over priced for the basics.  The food however is great and worth every penny.

h0FSaQwVsdILHhap1TRkKg.text: Took my wife to Shula's Steakhouse for our 15th Anniversary! The staff was amazing and the food was exquisite! This was my wife's first time there and she definitely wants to go back! I've been to the original location in Miami Lakes as well as the Tampa, FL locations many times and this one was equally as great! Thank you for a great night and an awesome dinner!

f4BE8c1rfkWzodhwkr2RJQ.text: Great foods, great service. I've tried many things on their menu and most of them are good. Although my favorite is the "beef tri tips" appetizer, really good deal for the value. You can have it as an entree. The seared tuna isn't so great. That's about it.

lH-SKXzPw_xP207wPC9tig.text: I shouldn't complain I got a free dinner for my birthday,but the steak is only mediocre. The onion soup is to die for,.my wife's crab cakes were great.The service that night was outstanding, there was nothing more our servers could to enhance the evening. I just wish they has a steak as good as Fleming's or City Hall.

YGWLR-jtc2uawWdCi9D9fQ.text: Food was awesome, staff seemed awesome minus our waitress that was a frazzled mess the entire night. She was nice, but forgot everything and was extremely slow. Def one of the nicer, better restaurants at Wild Horse Pass Casino.

8q7J76L2KQyDr0M9NlF3Lw.text: I was not impressed with Shula's.  They are a steakhouse and should know how to cook steak.  I ordered the cowboy Ribeye Medium rare.  When the steak is served they cut into the steak to check the temperature.  The Steak was blue rare, not even close to medium rare.  The mashed potatoes were dry and not very good.  This place is over priced and survives on the name alone.  I will never go back.

HzZtvDq8m0cJMV8_g1bVRg.text: We visited with a large party last night.  The food was outstanding!  It does take awhile, but it was well worth the wait.  Of course the filet, lump crab meat, and desserts were outstanding - the biggest surprise for me was how great the roasted corn is!

_07YmmMb3glx1fOdm7LFeQ.text: On on November 17, 2011 went to Shula's steak house and below are the reasons why I was disappointed with the food and the service"  1. We ordered a bottle of wine to the table and when the waitress poured the wine, she spilled it on our plates where we were eating bread and butter.  She then poured the 2nd glass and never even acknowledges there was a spill nor bothered to clean it up from the plate. 2. Our dinner took longer than expected - we waited about 45-55 minutes to get 2 steaks with sides as requested.  In most cases, steaks will not take an hour to cook or at least the waitress should give us heads up that it will take about an hour to get our food to the table.  I was very disappointed that our food took over an hour to come to the table. 3. The 12oz steak which was served to me was prepared well done as I asked for it to be medium - as you know there is a big difference between the 2 temperatures of the cooking the steaks.  I ate one bite and couldn't eat the rest.  Since our food took about an hour to come to the table, I didn't want to get another steak because it would have taken another hour or so for another steak.  4. Over the course of the night - I was very fed up with the food and most importantly fed up with the waitress as she lacked to be honest with her customers and no sense of professionalism if you make a mistake apologize!  It's not a big deal clean it up and listen to your customers.  This was a special dinner as this was my anniversary and I was very unhappy and displeased with the entire environment.  My girlfriend kept saying don't worry it's nothing and it's ok.  But honestly when you spend that much money on dinner you expect at a minimum to receive a decent food with a decent service.  But at the price I paid I expected top notch which I did not receive at all.    Waste of money! I don't recommend it and will never go there again.

JDkQVkIB1pyCi1_7mlCMGw.text: Well I went to this steakhouse on a double dinner date. It was not too busy, the service was good and the place is pretty nice too. I had the prime rib and it was very good, the mashed potatoes were excellent. The bill was not too pricey, I think for the 4 of us with drinks was only $200 or something, we might even have had an appetizer too. I enjoyed it but have only went that one time, I am due for another trip there I think. I do think The Keg at Tempe Marketplace is a better steakhouse though.

DIf2W_Q1kGXVpSBgrWIQMg.text: My parents treated the 6 of us to dinner @ Shula's Steakhouse last night.  We arrived @ 6:30 so the place was pretty slow, but picked up around 7:30 when all the tables were full.  The web site states reservations are required, and the dress is business casual.    The place is covered in football memoribilia, but does have a classy look with the dark wood and white linen table cloths.    Our server was helpful and funny and gave us some great suggestions from wine to dessert.  We started with shared salads, one couple shared the caesar salad and another the wedge.  The blue cheese was amazing!  We also shared 2 orders of the BBQ bacon wrapped shrimp as an appetizer.  They were stuffed with basil and so yummy!  For dinner, we enjoyed 2 bottles of Markham Merlot, 4 guests dined on Steak Mary Anne (2 5 oz. filets smothered in a peppercorn sauce) the rest of us simply ordered 8 oz. filets.  Each steak was prepared as ordered.  We also split sides of crab mac and cheese - with real crab meat - grilled asparagus, sauteed mushrooms and a couple baked potatos.  The sides work family style and were plenty for the 6 of us to get a taste of each.  For dessert we had both the chocolate lava cake which was rich and decadent, and the chocolate souffle which was much lighter and not as sweet.  We "rolled" out of there for $650.00 including tip.   The restaurant offers a 48 oz steak that, if finished, inducts you into Shula's 48oz Club.  The sticker price for just the steak is $85. Now that's a challenge for Man vs Food!  This is a really nice place to celebrate something special, or have a nice night out with your spouse.

lDZiIaQUZ_OWn3Z9kZqmTg.text: My husband and I went here for a date night.. We were a little hesitant since the restaurant was located in a Casino. It was one of the best meals that the have ever had. The steak was very tender and seasoned just right. This is a great place to go if you appreciate a great steak!   Our server could have been a little bit better, but I will for sure go back there!

LKX0PWAg61vVAWPV58qVuQ.text: My wife & I ate here Jan 30th, 2010.. WHOA this place rocks.. We sat down and they came right over to ask us for drinks. She ordered a sangria martini and I a vanilla vodka screwdriver. They bring a cart around showing you the different cuts & sizes of the meats.  We asked about the "Coaches 80th Bday special" 2 fillets, king crab legs, asparagus & mashed taters for both.. Plus a salad & a desert! And all for only $80.. The fillet was cooked perfectly, the asparagus had balsamic on it as well.. There was NOTHING wrong with the service or the meal. For our desert we shared a piece of 7 layer choco cake..   The service was A++ the food was top notch.. We will not hesitate to dine there again or recommend this place to anyone. Thank you for a wonderful 1st time visit!

f__tA-xNvQv18Vvzwn5R3w.text: Had dinner with my wife there last night. We started with the 'blackened scallops.' They had a bit of a bite but were cooked perfectly. My wife had the mixed grill that consisted of filet medallions, crab cake and scallops. All were excellent. I had the 16oz New York strip...cooked to perfection and had a great taste. We shared a baked potato and grilled mushrooms. The service was outstanding, the atmosphere was excellent. My only complaint was the waiter took away the football the hostess gave me on the way in. Apparently, the menu was printed on the football, that has since been replaced with real menu, but still carry on the tradition.

KRCsBEW8dlZFOGwiTDU1Bw.text: For my husband's birthday, I wanted to treat him with something special in the way of dinner, so we made reservations at Shula's. I had mentioned in passing at the time I made the reservations that it was my husband's birthday.  When we arrived, we were escorted to a little alcove with a nameplate that said "Happy Birthday" on it. Very neat. Our waitress was awesome! We never had to ask for refills which is a huge thing with me.  For the food, mostly it was wonderful with one small exception (which is why this isn't a five-star review).  We started with the BBQ Shrimp (with stuffed basil) as an appetizer. It was delicious! Highly recommend this appetizer.  Next up, we shared a Caesar salad. We told the waitress we were going to share the salad so we were a little surprised when it was brought out to us on one plate with a spare plate to shovel half of it on to... why couldn't they have done this for us to spare us the mess on the table? Anyway, Caesar salad was tasty - not the best (see The Grapevine in Scottsdale), but very good.   For our entrees, I got the 8oz filet and the birthday boy got the cowboy steak - we both requested Medium which was described as a warm pink. My filet came out as a medium-well - no pink. Husband's steak came out a bit more on the red side than warm pink. Odd since we both requested Medium and they came out so different. Husband's steak was FABULOUS - deliciously seasoned and melt in your mouth bliss!! Mine, if it had been medium, I imagine it would have also been fabulous, but as it was, it was good. I decided not to send it back because I didn't want to have to eat it after Husband was already done with his dinner.  We also shared the crab mac-and-cheese side which was VERY good. I highly recommend this side dish. My only nitpick on it is that it was a little oversalted, but this might not bother others - I just happen to not like salt very much.  For dessert, they treated us to the 7-layer chocolate cake. Warning... this cake is unbelievably rich so prepare yourself if you order it. It came with a strawberry sitting in strawberry sauce. The only thing that could have made this better would have been if the strawberry sauce had been drizzled over the cake.   Overall, a wonderfully romantic dinner with my Husband on his birthday. Excellent service. The food was VERY good with the exception of the uneven cooking of the steaks.

mEiXyPpKqfG2NHc1Eglb0w.text: Came here tonight for the second time for a birthday dinner. I had the 24oz cowboy cut (ribeye) and it was excellent. I ordered it medium rare as any usda prime steak should be ordered. It was juicy with a nice char on the outside and cooked to perfection. The truffel fries and grilled asparagus were also great. A nice glass of red wine set it right off! I definitely recommend this place for a great steak. But make sure you bring enough cash because its quite pricey

2yE_EjH4-VU7EOj2BGBWwA.text: Solidly good food with great service!  For starters, the lobster bisque is a generous serving of deliciousness!  The tenderloin tips are also really good and have a nice kick.  My bf got the crab cake, but I didn't try it.  The steaks are tender and cooked well.  The creamed spinach is delish, but a little skimpy on the serving size.  The lobster mashed potatoes are just okay -- mashed potatoes doused in lobster bisque and topped off with some small chunks of lobster.  The lobster mashed potatoes at City Hall are waaaaaay better, but they also cost $30 versus $12, so I guess you get what you pay for.  The drinks are strong -- especially the dragonberry mojito, which is more like a martini.  It's really good and really strong!  Lastly, I thought the servers were all very attentive and wonderfully pleasant!

rFkD-gpvH2Wvq_Vz2A9juA.text: Have always wanted to have dinner at Shula's because I am a fan of the coach. With the pricing of a top notch steak house you expect good service and exceptional food. Neither was delivered.  730pm reservations and seated promptly. It was a long time to get drinks, long time to place the order, and even longer to get the food. From order to arrival it was roughly an hour.  We had one waiter and it seemed that he had no help for 12 people. Average ticket for dinner was in excess of $150 with of course the mandatory tip.  Ahi was very good, Ribeye was below average but cooked well. Cut had grizzle and seasoning was weak. Crab Mac & cheese was good.  Sat with empty drinks several times and the long wait for food seemed to be a management issue.

GX4ZB3iIGJ9SH6dpoUMPLw.text: The steaks were amazing...cooked perfectly. The shrimp cocktail thick and meaty...great flavor. We enjoyed the great service of the very attentive staff. We look forward to a return trip back with visiting friends.

CnvSzt20pxnVw_cQ-TnXBw.text: Decided to check out the new casino and steakhouse.  I ordered the 24oz porterhouse and split it with my mother.  We also split a side order of asparagus and caesar salad.  Food was very good, steak was cooked to perfection (I ordered medium rare).  Price for the steak was a reasonable $40 based on other steakhouses in the area.  The reason I give 3 stars is that the service wasn't great.  This could be because they're new and have a few wrinkles to iron out.  I plan to go back in a couple of months to see if the service has improved.  I still prefer Durants and Donovans, however, if you're in the area or finding yourself hungry for a hunk of beef while losing money in the slot machines, spend your money upstairs at Shula's instead!

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States

uAXCFIbW6s11Sfm_kKAGhA.text: Went to Shula's last week while doing work in Phoenix.  I ate at the bar, had a pleasant bartender, delicious salad followed by some of the most tender Tenderloin Tips that I have ever had.  This is a top notch restaurant that is recommended by this steak connoisseur.  Also, from a bang for the buck perspective, it is tough to beat for this high level quality of food.  Why not the fifth star?  They didn't have a bar scene to speak of... although it was a Tuesday night.

WvSFyjbPIuizN-KjZpQX4Q.text: Took my wife for birthday dinner and was very disappointed. Steaks had no flavor, we're only warm and took 30 minutes.  The lobster Mac and cheese was equally not impressive. This is a Morton's want to be and not even coming close.  Spent $150 for two people and have made better steaks from costco. Don't waste your money.

aA4DQXy7eJ135Zvu92wl_w.text: If you enjoy cold food, served on cold plates this is the place for you.  Bring your canteen as well if your thirsty, drinks are scarce.

MCxfPcUQukhQwr5KCGcfug.text: I had been looking forward to trying out Shula's for quite some time based on a friend's recommendation who visited the one in Miami.  My wife and I love steak and we have tried many of the fine steak houses around the country (Ruth Chris in several cities, John Howie in Bellevue, WA, Fletcher's in Glendale, AZ, Pappas in Houston, Chop House in Dallas, etc.).   Besides excellent steak and sides, the one thing ALL of these restaurants have in common is fantastic service and service is always something you can count on at these high end steak places.  At least that was the case until now.  Our experience at Shula's in Chandler AZ at the Wild Horse Pass Hotel & Casino was the worst service I have EVER gotten at a high end eatery.  In fact, Applebee's and Shari's provide better service than we got at Shula's.  The wait staff was inattentive at best and downright rude at worst.  The service was slow starting from the beginning, it took almost ten minutes to get our water, the review of specials was poorly handled, the ordering took forever and the overall experience was very negative.  We were never asked if we wanted an appetizer, there was a manager walking around throughout our over two hour ordeal but we were never once asked how we were doing.  The only saving grace was that the food was excellent but you would at least EXPECT that for a $50 steak.  I will NEVER go back to this or any other Shula's and will spread the word as to my very bad experience.  Very, very sad!!

8tMM089_yArUKNeQ3VwrLQ.text: Let me start in by saying the food is always great when we go to Shula's.. we go on a birthday or anniversary, when I made the reservation I told them we were celebrating my wife's birthday, they usually bring a plac that says happy birthday on it and put on the table, I like to take a picture of the event!! No plac or no acknowledgment.. we kept telling them but it was like nobody cared!!! They also used to bring out a chocolate cake for the birthday girl, and again we had to remind them again guess what they brought out some Vanilla ice cream!!!! With a candle really?? Remember they are not cheep!! They used to at least made u feel like u were important, not this time!!!!!!!!!!! Might have to find a new place for upscale restaurant!!!!!!!

_RkbIYPKGDsgJa-fTfGUzg.text: Phenomenal meal with phenomenal service! We celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary and it was a near perfect experience! Thank u to Jennifer and Dan for their excellent attention and to the bartender for the wonderful margaritas!

n_yxVfq9HVugw_SR1EdygQ.text: I've been to Shula's a few times now unfortunately I've never had good experience at the steaks this time I tried the prime rib again was not very good and the service has hit or miss and this time it was okay server was all right hung out with us a little bit talked cuz they were slow but the boxer not sure if he was drunk or high kept on spilling water on the table and he knocked my glass over once it's kind of annoying other than that it was a rain now the chocolate souffle was to die for I never had anything this good in a souffle it was creamy Aerie super chocolatey if that's even a word but if it's not that's a new word for this thing I want to go back and sit at the bar and eat two of these by myself I also had the bread pudding that was good boiling hot though

JJ1zvQUj7PeypNV70_csQA.text: It's been many years since I first dined at Shula's Steak House.  In particular, my first experience with this chain was at their Miami Lakes locations. We had just finished the acquisition and transition of several dozen heavy equipment dealerships all over Georgia and Florida.  To celebrate the transition of the Miami Flagship location, our team opted to dine here.  I was quite impressed with them before, and I am still impressed with them to date.   The decor of this place can be characterized as subdued elegance. Its dark woods are formal and imposing. Some would say that it is quite classy and old-world.  The colors are those that a CEO of a large corporation often chooses for his office.  Upon arrival, we were greeted by two of the most sincere and friendliest hostesses I've met in a long time. They were genuinely glad to welcome us as we arrived.  Shula's is tucked away on the second floor of the Wild Horse Pass Hotel & Casino, just to the right of the escalators. The are across the second floor lobby from Chrome.  It's not exactly easy to find, but there are sufficient enough hotel staff to guide you to this establishment.  Upon being seated, our hostess offered to procure for us our refreshments. We opted for just plain water for starters, and we were provided with two Italian mineral waters.   The wait staff were quite formal, poised, and elegant. Our waiter, although new, was well versed with the menu, and offered us several suggestions for this particular evening's meal.  We were famished, and wanted to get right to the point. My beloved wife ordered the 16 oz prime rib. I ordered the Filet Mignon Trio. We did opt to try their French Onion soup as an introduction.  The French Onion soup was as good as I've ever had. The cheese was properly heated and enveloped the top of the soup bowl without appearing to be burnt. The underlying broth and onions were quite savory. Sometimes, the broth can be too salty or overwhelming, as the mixture of both the cheese and onions battle for flavor supremacy. This one had a great balance to it.  My wife's prime rib was cooked to perfection. It was tender and scrumptious both inside and out, and the texture was delicate. Each bite, regardless of whether it was in the anterior or interior of the meat, was absolutely delectable.   My Filet Mignon Trio was quite excitingly prepared. I'm not a fan of the Blue Cheese crust version of the three, but the mixture was quite enlivening and original. My favorite of the trio was the Oscar Style. the layering of the crab cakes with the bearnaise sauce on top of the meat was just outstanding.   I would've given this a 5 star rating, but I do have two criticisms regarding our meal and the location of this restaurant:  My side asparagus, which I am very particular about, was seared to the point that it was burnt. I'm sure that it is what they intended, but the execution was not quite up to par. They overdid it on this one, and left a gritty burnt taste in my mouth that was hard to get rid of.  The next is the location. Don't get me wrong, the Wild Horse Pass seems like a top notch Hotel / Casino. So, locating Shula's within its halls is a great addition and hallmark. However, for those of us that have an aversion to the overwhelming smell of cigarette smoke upon entering, the smell detracted from our appetite. This was exacerbated by the fact that my wife's breathing issues began to manifest themselves after only a few minutes of entering the premises. It took us a 30 minutes of sitting in the front balcony for her to recover from the dreaded smoke cloud that permeated the lobby and the gambling area which we had to traverse to get to the restaurant.  Such a renowned restaurant shouldn't have to have its guests be subjected to this. You may say, what did we expect? This was a casino as well!  We have have a home and partially live in Las Vegas. We've been to the Wynn, MGM, Bellagio, Ceasar's Palace, and other hotels countless times to dine there. Somehow they have managed to eviscerate much of this prevailing and overwhelming smoke years ago, knowing that this has a negative impact on some guests.  Perhaps one day, the Wild Horse Pass can solve this as well, so as to not negatively impact such a wonderful dining establishment as Shula's.

Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lump Crab Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States

GjQBAvfzqlomHxPPYugHKw.text: Great food; fine dining with view of many football memorabilia from Coach Don Shula's tenure in the NFL and a view of a Vince Lombardi trophy.  Came here with my company, so we had a private dining room for about 18 people.  Service was impeccable.  I had scallops.  Serving portions are large; there were 5 large scallops with family style sides of mashed potatoes, roasted brussel sprouts, asparagus.  For dessert, I chose the 7-layer chocolate cake.  Very good; not too sweet.  I would come back again as some of the other dinner selections which other colleagues had were the 22-ounce rib eye, filet mignon-all which looked ver, very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Vince Lombardi trophy
Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. Football memorabilia

RJopTQ3Wdaoj5hYN4ub8Tg.text: One of the best steaks in town. I recommend this place to any one. Great staff and quick service.

3r6crtZKSv7AZPXTht5CAg.text: My boyfriend and I went here to celebrate the other night.  We've heard amazing things about this restaurant so wanted to try it out.   We started with the calamari fries which were actually very good.  Then I had a wedge salad, which actually hit the spot.  For the main course, I got the 12 oz. filet.  Unfortunately, this was a little lacking in flavor.  There was hardly any salt, and the sauce that came with the steak was fairly bland.  For our sides we got the potatoes au gratin and the brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts was very undercooked, but the potatoes were excellent - warm with the right amount of cheese.     As it was a special occasion (we called this in advance), they brought us over a celebratory piece of cake.  This was very nice, but it would have been a little more upscale to get a piece of chocolate lava cake or cheesecake.  Or at least have a glass of champagne and let us pick our dessert.     We laughed about our experience in jest later, but I don't think we'll be spending another $180 here in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States. A nice tribute to Don Shula

zoI1vLmIbsMolbjOJhvNxg.text: Love this place.  Both food quality and service are top notch.  I especially enjoy being part of the Team Shula mailing list and receiving the free entree birthday gift.  I would highly recommend dining here.

zK21wLRXYoxg4MHkV3qeMA.text: Very disappointed. Went for our 49th anniversary. First, we called for reservations but did not get a call back. Decided to go anyway.  Service was very slow. 15 minutes to get our drinks. Salad, which was one of the highlights of the evening, arrived soon after we ordered but the it was probably 45 minutes for the steak to arrive. We ordered a filet which was dry and cooked a little too long. Tender but would have been flavorless had we not ordered sauce to go with it. The gratin potatoes were undercooked, would have been good had the potatoes been done.   Why didn't we send it back?  No one came to ask about the meal for at least 10 minutes. Our free dessert for our special day was ice cream with a little fresh fruit on it. Not very creative. Our wait staff came by very little to see if we needed anything. Not the type of service I expect for a high end steakhouse.

xAEQQLhTSAgNBBGKsGGUHg.text: Have been here several times and keep hoping it will get better because the location is great for our girls night out.  But sadly last night will be our last coming here.  The reason is the service.   The place was not even especially crowded yet we could not get basics like a refill on our tea/water.   Had to flag someone down to get our take home box/bag and the attitude from the female waitress was apathy at best.   Definitely got the feeling she would have liked to have been anywhere but there waiting on us.  But she is not the only one.  The section we sat in last visit the male waiter was the same way with same attitude.    Maybe indicative of general culture of management at that facility.   The steak was good and food ok.   But lots of places have good steaks and better side dishes.   Would not recommend.

smwBb6rVik0GfYNHg7XS0w.text: Dinner was okay. The calamari was great, the twice baked potato was good, but the star of the dish, the filet mignon, was over cooked. It was well done, dry, and just not good. I ordered it medium. I was hungry so I ate it, but I tried to eat slow enough that I could show the waiter. However waiter didn't come check and see how our food was and by the time they did the whole table had finished their food, including me. They did give a free dessert when I told them about it, so that's something.... but I still spent $50 on a bad steak and for that price I expect perfection, this was far from it. All and all the place isn't bad, but it's also not good enough to justify the price point. I've had better for less and others that charge as much are consistently good instead of hit or miss.

WjqYJ-GbyIs4h7LgH4PD7A.text: I have never had finer food anywhere including at Michelin starred restaurants and 5 star resorts.  The deep fried lobster is heavenly and the steaks are the most flavorful, tender and juicy of any steak I have ever eaten.  My hubby and mother-in-law felt the same way.  Bravo!!

NmyU8QvPCZoYGEo2ghwNuA.text: This is a place that sats NO TANK TOPS however when asked to see the dress code policy I was told we don't have it in writing we just say it verbally WHAT A BUNCH OF SHIT. Wow I must say that the so called manager on duty was very disrespectful to me and I can not give this place any thing but a major thumbs down for picking and choosing whom they will allow in to eat according to what they are wearing. If a real manager would like to talk my email address is katier1959@hotmail.com

w475tMp6If3Mk2RVDIZwDg.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Grand and decided to treat ourselves on a date night for dinner. The restaurant is located inside the Wild Horse Pass Casino and it was a elegant setting. Our server was nice and somewhat a bit cocky. We ordered the surf and turf to split however he brought us both one plate each. I didn't want to complain. The food was good but we ended up throwing out the half steak and half lobster. That was the only thing that bothered me and why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. My fiance and I are not heavy eaters and we share a lot of our meals when we dine out so we don't waste food or money. Overall, good quality food prepared well.

photos.caption: Photo of Shula's Steak House - Chandler, AZ, United States

KMzYIbHMxrC6WdPQWV7Wzw.text: What a disappointment!  Four of us went to dinner.  One ribeye, 2 filet and one wagu burger.  Ribeye had no spices, no grill flavor and was very bland.  I tried my wife's filet and it was just as bad. They tell you at the table the their meat is a higher grade than prime.  I don't believe it since my ribeye was also tough with no marbling.  The wedge salad was boring with a watery ranch dressing.  The green beans for just average.  Another very big disappointment was that they charged $32.00 for a wagu hamburger.  Yes you read that correctly - $32.00!!!! The 6 oz. filets were $38.00 and the 14 oz. ribeye was $43.00  Salads and sides were extra.  I could have gotten a far better meal at Texas Roadhouse for 1/3 the cost.  I will never be back.

lgjLPvt8qdrfbkbUYks3Pg.text: This is my first check in at Shula's however ur been here a half dozen times.  In previous trips here things were stellar with zero complaints. This last trip was to celebrate my parent's birthdays.  They wanted somewhere they have never been and after talking up how great Shula's was, I was able to convince my brother's family as well as my parents to try one of the best Steak houses in the valley in my opinion.    Our service that evening was fantastic, our waiter was good and was attentive.  The party of 10 ordered water and two glasses of red wine and 4 apps.  About 15-20 mins pass and 3 of the apps come out and still no wine.  We inquire about the missing app and it's brought out, it was "accidentally" left off the tray   Same time the two glasses of wine finally show up.   All is well and the entrees ordered.    All of the orders consisted of ribeyes and filets and 4-5 sides. After some time, seemed to be near 30-40 mins out dinners came out and at first glance everything looked good.  Again we were missing a plate, this time a missing side that again missed being placed on the tray.    With the exception of one of the steaks, all of them were over cooked.  We all ordered out steaks either medium or medium rare.   My family decided that we would not send all of the meals back because we were going to wait another 30-40 mins and be late for our show that evening.   As we wrapped up dinner, service again was good, front of house staff was also good.   We left full but disappointed at the quality of the food for the evening.    I myself was majorly disappointed because I boasted to my family about how great Shula's is and that evening it was a huge let down.  Not being mean but the quality of how the steaks were cooked was barely better than A steak I would have at Texas Roadhouse.   At $50+ dollars a plate my family and I expected much better.  The bill totaled over $500 for the dinner, sure didn't feel like it was a 500 dollar dinner.    I'm sorry to say that my parents and brother 's family will most likely never return to Shula's. As for me and my family, I'm on the fence as well. Not sure what happened since m last visit, but i'm Leary of returning if the quality of the food is slipping.   3 stars for the service and front of house staff.  Kitchen needs some attention.    Severely disappointed.....

2sS1Q-XAnuC2QnrjkJKH2Q.text: My pre-dinner drink was a well priced Blanton's bourbon at $14 with a decent pour. My wife ordered a signature cocktail which she didn't like and we figure it was the sweet and sour mix from the "gun" which isn't a good sign. The bartender made her a better drink in exchange.  Dinner...oh dinner. Nothing was bad, nothing was outstanding. That's a great review for McDonald's but a terrible one for a supposedly top notch steak house. I won't return.

rHrZjy73f4dIcePyTzOgsA.text: Great surf and turf after winning boat loads of cash at the casino.  Props to Artie the champ.  The Lobster and filet were cooked to perfection and the sides of mushrooms and and potatoes were awesome.  The service was superb and my only knock is we had to wait for dinner at 9:30.   Dinner was on the Tribe tonight!
